4428183/4384574/4434570.title: Homemade Toys
4428183/4384574/4434570.text:
Young girls take great delight in gathering flowers.  When they have them gathered they string them together and make chains and girdles.  They make dolls from rags and old clothes.  They wound the rags together like a doll.  Boys made tops and whips out of wood.  They got a bit of twine or a rope on to it and they made a whip.People used to make faces of men and women out of turnips.  They can cut eyes, ears and noses out in the turnips.  They can also cut the pulp out of the turnips and put candles lighting into it.My mother when she was small used to make a whistle from a tall herb called a kice.  She cut a hole in it and put a piece of wood inside fora tongue and six holes to work her fingers on to make it whistle.Another toy she made was to root a briar and dress the root of it and make a pipe of it.  She had to scoop the root of the briar and make it the shape of the head of a pipe and get and ash stick and pare it for the shank and it makes a lovely pipe.Another old toy was Crow Mill made out of a piece of tin and a hole in the centre of it.  She stuck a hole in the ground and the wind would whirl it up an down.The girls make necklaces from daisies when they are in bloom.  They also make dolls.  This is how to make them.  Take some wool and wind it round your hand till it is thick enough to make the dolls body.  Slip it off your hand and tie a piece of wool around it about half an inch down.  This will form the head.
(continues on next page)

4428089/4377771/4435181.title: Handmade Toys
4428089/4377771/4435181.text:
Long ago parents made toys for their children because toys were very scarce and very dear. For girls they made dolls and dolls' houses. This is how they made them. They made a doll by getting a piece of cloth and sewing it in the shape of a doll. Then they stuffed it with rags and painted a face on it.Dolls' houses were made by getting a piece of smooth timber and and the parents put it together. When it was made the children played with the toy while their mothers worked. If their mothers had any spare room she would put all the toys in there and put the children in there to play when she was busy.
(continues on next page)

Kidney Trouble: A herb called creepe which grows on the walls is a cure for kidney trouble. Sore Throat: To burn salt on a pan and then put round your neck is a cure for a sore throat. Sprain: If you got a sprain it is a great thing to bathe your foot or hand or wherever you got the sprain in potatoe water and to rub goose-grease of it after having it dried.



Chain of Daises: was made with a needle and thread. Put the needle through the heart of the daisy, and let it back on the thread. Dolls: are made with papers and cloth. That is a piece of cloth sewed together and  packed with papers and putting paper hands and feet on it and covering it with cloth. Then to mark out a face on it with a pencil or pen and ink.

Pop-Guns: were made out of twigs of the alder tree, and by boreing the centre of it to take the soft stuff out of it.Tops - They made tops out of spools by cutting off the side of the spool and then shaping it into a top. They insert a bit of thin wood in the opening of the spool.Cradle Birds. They made cradle birds out of rods of the willow tree. They would make the cradle bird like a small cradle with only three in it and they would leave a small hole in it for the bird to go in and then shake a grain of oats in the bottom of the basket.Snares = They made snares out of thin wire. They would have two bits of sticks at each end of the wire a have a running knot on the wire so that the rabbit when he would stick his head in the wire he would get caught. They are still to be seen.

They used make a bundle of cloth and put paper round it and sew it on to the body. They used make a dress of coloured cloth for it. They coloured the face with paint, and some of them used be finer than some of the shop dolls.Tops: They boys used to make tops from thread spools. 4427835/4348764/4436240.text:

Then saw-dust was put into it and the cloth was sewed at the bottom to keep it from coming out.Then four sticks were covered with cloth and two legs were sewed on.Rags were got and

4428186/4384829/4443911.text:
Long ago the boys and girls made toys, - bows and arrows, boats, spinning tops, and many other things in their spare time.Bows and ArrowsA small piece of stick was found then cord, the cord was fastened on to the stick, this made the arrow itself, then another stick was found slipped on between the stick and cord, then the arrow was completed.Paper BoatsA piece of paper turned and twisted inside out, stitched and gummed completes this task

4427882/4354136/4446490.title: Homemade Toys
4427882/4354136/4446490.text:
While children are not strong enough to help in the house-work they enjoy making toys to occupy their little minds.       The girls make dolls, daisy chains, and neck-laces.  They first make the head of the doll by getting rags and making a ball of them.  This they cover over with a white cloth and have the head completed.  They do the same with the body and put little legs and hands on it.   They then sew the head on to the body, and make a little frock for it.   The doll is then completed.     On long summer days the children are to be seen out through the green fields picking daisies.   They join them together by putting a hole in the end of the stem of one and shoving another through it.   They continue this until they have a long string of them.  This is called a daisy chain. 4427882/4354138/4446492.title: Homemade Toys
4427882/4354138/4446492.text: A long time ago when people could not buy toys for their children from the townspeople they made their own.     A favorite toy was a sling which can throw stones a good distance.  It is made of a long string with a bit of leather in the middle, a stone is put in the leather; the string is swung round the head and one end of it let go.  Then the stone whirls away.     Another toy was a whistle.  This was made from the tin part of the cartridge of a gun.  The cartridge was first put into the fire, and the paper part of it burned away and then the two heads hammered together.  A nail was driven through them and a hole was left.  Tops were made by driving a nail through a long piece of wood and shaping it in the form of a top.

4428163/4383127/4447410.title: Homemade Toys
4428163/4383127/4447410.text:
There are several toys which boys make at home.One of the best of these is a conker which is made from the nuts of the Horsechestnut. It is made by driving a nail through the centre of the nut, thus leavening a hole through it. Then a cord is brought through it and a big knot put on one end of it so that the cord won't slip thorugh the hole, and the conker is completed.The game of conkers can be played by two persons each having a conker. They stand a few feet apart and one holds his conker out for the other to hit it with his one as there is a length of string out of the nut, and so on in turns until one of the conkers is broken. The way we make our dolls is by getting hay and piece of cloth and by sewing the cloth round the hay. Then we get a piece of stick and pare it until it is round and then we mark two eyes in it with a pencil and get two pieces of sticks for the hands and two more for the legs. The pellets I use are round stones.I often make a crib for catching birds. First of all I go to the woods and gather a great number of sally rods. Then I tie four together. Then I plait the other rods in between up along until it is made. The birds we catch

4427847/4350224/4448133.title: Toys and Pastimes
4427847/4350224/4448133.text:
Toys and PastimesMary Daly, Crimlin, Irishtown got the following information about toys and pastimes from her uncle which he got from his father Thomas Daly who died when he was seventy three years of age, thirty one years ago.About forty years ago the boys of this place used to spend their spare making toys out of spools and spinning them. They used to make whistles out of tin. He also told her that in the summer evenings when the girls had nothing to do they used to go out in a field where there was a lot of daisies growing making daisy chains. Sometimes they used to make dolls out of potatoes. First of all they got a potato and made two halves of it. Then they used to make two holes in it for eyes. After that they made the shape of the nose and mouth and inserted two sticks in the potato to represent the feet.

4427878/4353365/4449383.title: Toys Made at Home
4427878/4353365/4449383.text:
About six years ago I made a pop gun. When I was making it I got a piece of an alder tree. I burned out the pulp with a heated iron. The hole was about a quarter of an inch wide. Then I got a piece of stick which ran freely through the space in the other stick.Sometimes I made a sling I cut a piece of leather from an old boot. Then I put two small holes at each end. I tied a piece of cord to each of the holes. Then I put a stone in the leather and spun it round quickly. When I let go one string the stone flew away.About four years ago I made a top from a cotton reel. I cut one side of the reel into a tapering point. Then I got a small piece of stick and stuck it through the top. Oft I tried to draw pictures from a newspaper.When making a catapult I cut a forked stick from a tree. Then I put a small cut at each end. I got a used tube from an old bicycle. I cut two thin strips and stuck in the slits. Then I tied a bit of feather other end.
(continues on next page)

4427878/4353367/4449387.title: Toys Made at Home
4427878/4353367/4449387.text:
We make many toys at home for example I made a top. I got an empty spool and I pared one end of it. Next I got a piece of thin straight stick. I cut off a piece of it with a pocket-knife.I next made a whip which I from a piece of stick and a bit of cord. I fastened the cord to one end of the stick. I also made a kite. I got a piece of paper and made it into the shape of a fish. Then I tied a piece of string to the top of the paper, then I flung it into the air.I made a pop gun also. I got a piece of stick from an older tree. I pushed out the soft substance with a knitting pin. Then I got a piece of thin stick and fastened a piece of cloth to the top of it. Next I put a hole in a cork and pushed it into the stick.Another favourite toy of mine is a catapult. I got the inner tube of a motor car. I cult two strips elastic from it. 4428153/4382492/4450568.text:
Home made toys and articles.A candle stick can be made out of a turnip. it is made by cutting the top and end off the turnip leaving the widest part of it. Then cut a hole in the middle of it (the top) the width of the candle to hold it.A whistler can be made out of a sally, ash, or poplar tree. A straight bit of a young bough is got about six ins. long. It is then tapped with the back of a knife until the skin gets loose. The skin is ringed about an inch from the end. 4427849/4350343/4450623.title: Homemade Toys
4427849/4350343/4450623.text: Every boy likes to amuse himself so he makes toys.  One of those toys is a model aeroplane.  This is made by cutting six inches off the handle of an old twig and boring a hole about three inches down through the middle of the stick with a red hot bit of fencing wire.  Then stick a bit of round stick through the hole.  This done, out a hole half way across the stick (as shown in fig. 1)so that the inside stick is revealed.  Then fix a propeller on the top of the stick. (fig. 2)  Having done this wind a piece of cotton round the stick (fig.3)Having done this wind a piece of cotton round the stick (fig.3)  Then pull the cotton and the propeller will spin.  When the cotton is all gone the propeller will shoot into the air.

4427849/4350344/4450624.title: Homemade Toys
4427849/4350344/4450624.text:
There were many toys made in the homes of the people long ago.  Few things were bought in shops.Girls used to string flowers together and they used to make strings of flowers from them.Tops were in use long ago and are in use even to the present day. 4428153/4382506/4450681.title: Homemade Toys
4428153/4382506/4450681.text: How to make a daisy chain.First you must gather a bunch of daisies and then take one daisy and make a little slit in the middle of the stem.  Then take another daisy and put the stem through the slit.  Then pull the stem through to the head of the daisy and so on until the chain is made.

4427850/4350449/4450955.title: Homemade Toys
4427850/4350449/4450955.text:
Many boys and girls long ago made their own toys such as follows.  Nice matches are required for making spinning tops out of spools by putting a nail through the spool and shaping it like a top.Bow and arrow, of willow rod and twine.Cradlebird - Elder sticks (20) willow rod cross wise (about 1) standing up on 1 stick y.Catapult - sticks and rubber, and a bit of leather,Lamp out of turnip, dolls out of turnip.If you get a piece of stick and a piece of rope and tie the rope to the end of the stick you will have a whip. Girls always make dolls,  Boys make tops out of the top of a handle

4427908/4356790/4451603.title: Local Folklore - Homemade Toys
4427908/4356790/4451603.text:
Some boys and girls love to make toys in their spare time.  The girls usually make dolls or make chains of flowers.  The toys that boys mostly make are, tops made from thread spools, spinners, made from a button and a piece of thread.  Snares, made from snare wire.  Sometimes boys make snares from horse hair.  Boys make slingers, with a piece of leather and two strings.
(continues on next page)

4428074/4375418/4452276.text:
Boys made tops from thread spools and from a piece of a stick such as an old handle of a spade or shovel. They cut a piece of the handle about two or three inches long. The piece of timber is about one and a half inches wide. They cut the timber with a knife until one end of it is about a quarter of an inch wide. Then they get a nail. They cut the head off the nail. 4428156/4382428/4452380.text:

4427919/4358104/4453847.title: Homemade Toys
4427919/4358104/4453847.text:
When I was young I spent most of my childhood making various kinds of toys. At that period of my life I took great delight in toy making.When I was about three years of age I made a doll. First I got a piece of hay, and put it into a piece of cloth. Then I sewed the piece of cloth in which I put the hay on all sides, and made it into the form of a body. After that I got two sticks and fastened them on the body for two hands. When I had that finished I got two more sticks and fastened them on the end of the body for two legs. Next I got a great number of old rags sowed them together and placed them on her
(continues on next page)

4427827/4347845/4453927.title: Toys and Pastimes
4427827/4347845/4453927.text:
All girls and boys has some pastime such as making chains necklaces dolls and hat out of paper and rushes and dressing themBoys has pastimes such as making wooden carts and wooden tops and spinning them. They also get pleasure in making  cages, and cribs and pop-guns from boretree. They also mak rabbit snares out of wire and strings and pigs. They make carts out of turnips and make wheel for them out of spools. The crib is from sallies and bore-tree. They get two piece of bore-tree and have them at each end and join them with four sallies one from each corner
(continues on next page)

4427913/4357194/4454071.title: Homemade Toys
4427913/4357194/4454071.text:
Boys used to make guns from elder branches.First they would get a piece of elder branch about a foot long and bore it through with a red hot iron they would next get a cork and fit it into one of the elder branch.  They they would bore the cork with a knitting needle.  Next they would get a piece of sally rod about six inches long not quite as large as the hole in the elder branch.  Next they would get a piece of woolen thread and tie it round one end of the sally until it is the exact size of the hole in the elder branch.  Then they would put it into a pale of water and pull the sally rod up to the top and it would fill with water.  Then they would push the rod forward and it
(continues on next page)

4427913/4357201/4454093.title: Homemade Toys
4427913/4357201/4454093.text:
In olden times the children used to make their own toys and some of that work is carried on yet.  Boys used to make guns from elder branches.  They would cut a piece of a branch about a foot long and bore a hole down the centre.  Then they would get a stick that would go through the hole.  They would then tie a piece of woolen thread round the stick at the top.  The stick would then be pushed through the hole.  This gun was used for shooting water.  The name of it is a "pop gun".   When they want to fill the gun with water they would draw up the stick and to shoot they would press the stick down again.  Lanterns were made from turnips.  In olden
(continues on next page)

4428272/4390507/4454403.title: Homemade Toys
4428272/4390507/4454403.text:
Girls and boys make toys in their spare time. Girls make daisy-chains,   dolls, dolls dresses. Boys make tops,   guns, pipes, kites, carts, teddybears,  snares for rabbits.The girls make the daisy-chains out of flowers and rushes. They make dolls out off shavings and cloth. They put the shavings into the cloth and sew it and then they shape the head and they make the feet out of sticks. The boys make the tops out of spools and a piece of stick. The boys make the tops out of spools and a piece of stick. They sharp[en?] a stick and put it into the hole in the spool and then they spin it. The guns are made out of a piece of bootery bush and a piece of steel. The inside is taken out of the stick and the hole is cut about a inch long and a piece of steel the same length as the stick and when the steel is pulled up it will shoot. A piece of cork is put in and the steel shoots it out. They make the carts out off a box and they put two wheels of a bicycle on it and then they put two shafts in it with two slates of boards. A piece of a forked stick is used to mak [make?] a catapult. Two pieces of the rubber about four inches in length and a pocket of leather are also required. The pieces of rubber are tied to the tops of the stick and the leather is tied to the other ends joining them together. The catapult is used for firing stones at birds or rabbits. It throws the stones with great force and a person has a good aim when using it. The
(continues on next page)

4428272/4390508/4454404.title: Homemade Toys
4428272/4390508/4454404.text:
(continued from previous page)
stone is put into the leather pocket and pulled strongly. Then the leather is let go and the stone is thrown.



A bootery gun is made with a piece of bootery about six inches long, the soft centre is taken out with a red hot piece of iron. Then a stick called a ram – rod is cut about half an inch shorter than the gun. A piece of paper wet and tightly rolled up or a bean is put into the gun at each end. The ram rod is then forced through and the paper is shot out.A cradle bird was made in this way. Four strong scollops were got. Then a pack of thinner scollops were got and woven in and out of the four strong ones. Then it was put up with the aid of a stick. When the bird went in the cradle Bird fell down and he was trapped.A snare was made in this way. A piece of thin bull wire was got and rounded to make a noose. Then it was attached to two sticks which were stuck tightly in the ground for fear the rabbit would take the snare on its neck.

4427926/4358145/4454567.title: Homemade Toys
4427926/4358145/4454567.text:
The boys make snares for catching fish and for catching rabbits and hares. They make snares from hair from a horses tail and a rod. They make tops from tread spools and cradlebirds for catching birds. They girls makes dolls and daisy chains. They make dolls from cloth and wool and then they dress them and make a cradle for them. Boys makes catapults slings pop guns and toy carts. They make the pop gun from a piece of elder tree with a hollow in the (in the) middle. When making a catapult they get two pieces of rods and put them standing up with the tops of them together and put a bit of string around the rods and when they pull the string the stone will go. When they are making a cart they get a box and put wheels on it with a thread spool and put shafts on it and pull it with a string. When

4428077/4375866/4455148.title: Homemade Toys
4428077/4375866/4455148.text: Home Made Toys    5.12.38On long winter nights we amuse ourselves in making pictures or cutting out pictures and putting them unto a blank book made of brown paper. We stick them on with paste. Sometimes I amuse myself in making tops out of empty spools. I get a bit of a stick and put it up in the hole of the spool for a spike. Sometimes I amuse myself reading the paper or setting seed in an old box.Some summer days I go out and sit down in some field and pick some dasies and make a daisy chain. I get a daisy and put a hole in it and put the other daisy in the hole.                                     Holly Walshe                                     Erris Road                                     Crossmolina                                     Co. Mayo

4428166/4383571/4456186.title: Local Homemade Toys
4428166/4383571/4456186.text:
In every land we find that little children love to play little games and if they have no companion they play with there simple toys for all children love toys and many love to make toys themselves.In our District the most common toys made by boys and girls are tops from spools, kites tractors, rag-dolls snares for rabbits a catapult and a medal from a turnip.Tops are made by children in the district.  They get a spool and cut one side of the spool in the form of a point.  Then they put a nail down in the hold of the spool and spin the top.Kites are still made in the District.  The way a kite is made in my district is first you get two
(continues on next page)

4428071/4375033/4457346.title: Homemade Necklaces
4428071/4375033/4457346.text: Little girls made necklaces also long ago. When the roan berries were ripe they gathered some. They also got a needle and thread. The thread is put through the roan berries - one by one 'till they are all used up and the necklace long enough to go round the little girl's neck.

4428149/4381988/4458383.title: Play Toys
4428149/4381988/4458383.text: Long ago the little girls used make their own rag-dolls and their clothes.  In the Summer they made daisy-chains.  They played skipping, knucks, swinging, thread-the-needle, weigh-the-buckety, rounders, cabbies, tig, high-gates and see-saw.  The boys used play the different games of ball, marbles, tug-o'-war, snaring rabbits with snares, leap-frog, climbing trees, hand-ball, sack-racing, doing cat's turn, duck, cat, and chinas.  Some bad boys used rob birds' nests.  In Winter they had their favourite games of hurling and football.  Both boys and girls used play battle-door or shuttle-cock, with a bat and a cork.   When the long nights came they had other games such as rabbits and marbles and they make boats, boxes, hats, fans, and flowers.  All these were great Irish games, and are being carried on till this day.  They had no bought-made toys as we have now.

4428230/4387557/4458668.title: Homemade Toys
4428230/4387557/4458668.text:
Every boy and girl finds amusement in making toys in their spare time.                 Girls string flowers for girdles, even at the present time, and boys make tops from thread spools. They also make guns from elder branches. But, long ago, the toys which children had were different to what the children have now. The boys made reins long ago that they do not make now. They put three tacks round the hole of the spool, and put the wool round the tacks twice. Then they got a knitting needle and put the bottom piece of wool over the top, and over the tack so as to make a stitch. Then the end of the wool was put through the hole in the spool, and pulled every time a stitch is made, the thread
(continues on next page)

4428274/4390744/4459068.title: Homemade Toys
4428274/4390744/4459068.text: Boys and girls long ago made toys for themselves and some make them yet. Girls make daisy chains out of daisies. Boys used to make tops and kites [?] out of wood also spinning wheels, from a old spool. Girls make toys out of wood and cloth. Snares were made for catching rabbits with a piece of wire and a stick.

4428238/4387858/4462820.title: Homemade Toys
4428238/4387858/4462820.text: 773-38 Home-Made ToysSome years ago there was a man who lived in The Leinster House in Castle Street Dalkey, who could make great toys. He is dead now. He used to make all sorts of toys. Some of the toys he used to make were:- trains, horse and carts, motor cars, dolls houses and the toy furniture for them, box carts and other toys.  He used to make most of the toys in such a way that the screws he put them together with, could be taken out and put back in the same places as they were. It is said that he used to sell these toys he made to big toy shops in Dublin. The mans name was Mr. Richardson. He was about 70 years of age when he died.From Mrs. Parker. 28 Corrig Rd.Dalkey. Aged 77 years.

4427943/4359708/4462947.title: Homemade Toys - Daisy Chain
4427943/4359708/4462947.text:
Daisy ChainTo make a daisy chain one would have to get some daisies, a needle and thread.  Pull the stems off the daisies. Put the daisies on the needle and let them slip down to the end of the thread.  When it is long enough the needle is cut from the thread.  Tie the two ends of the thread together.DollMy grandaunt told me when she was small she played with a doll.  This is how she made her doll.  She got a potato, a turnip and some timber.  She put the timber through the potato and the turnip but it was not to appear at either end.  She put a stick each side side of the turnip for hands and two sticks under the turnip for legs.  Celine Warde



My grandaunt told me when she was small she played with a doll. This is how she made her doll. She got a potato, a turnip and some timber. She put the timber through the potato and the turnip but it was not to appear at either end. She put a stick each side side of the turnip for hands and two sticks under the turnip for legs.

4427943/4359710/4462953.title: Homemade Toys - A Turnip
4427943/4359710/4462953.text:
A TurnipGet a turnip, cut it in halves, and shape a man's face on it.  I could also cut six of the letter H and join them together again, and I could cut a figure to resemble the face of a person.Folding PaperThe following articles are made by folding paper, a purse, sugarbox, clown's hat, toy-boat.Maggie MulroyBallyvary



The following articles are made by folding paper, a purse, sugarlox, clown's har, toy-boat.

4427943/4359711/4462955.title: Homemade Toys - A Pop Gun
4427943/4359711/4462955.text: To make a pop gun one must get a piece of boartree six inches long and six inches of steel.  Pare off the outside skin of the boartree. Make a hole through the piece of the boartree.  Cut out about three inches half way through, leaving an inch and a half at each end.  Fill up the hole at one end with a piece of stick.  Put one end of the steel against the stick and bend the other end of the steel and put it against the other and of the boartree.  Put a small stone in the hole that is not filled.  Pull the steel and the stone will go. Patrick ComminsRathruaneBohola

4427943/4359712/4462958.title: Homemade Toys - To Snare Rabbits
4427943/4359712/4462958.text: To snare rabbits one must get snare wire and a bit of stick.  Make a loop at one end of the wire.  Fasten the other end to a piece of stick.  Put the stick in ground near the burrow and the loop of the wire in the run that the rabbit has, from one burrow to an other.  When a rabbit is running from one burrow to an other he keeps his head down and as he runs along he goes in in the loop and his is snared.Patrick ComminsRathruaneBohola

4428241/4387793/4463181.title: Pastimes for the Winter - How to Catch Birds
4428241/4387793/4463181.text: Choose a place where a bird has the habit of looking for worms Next get a wire box or something you can see through then get a little piece of stick about six inches long and place it under the edge of the box so that the box is lifted then tie a long piece of string to the end of the stick Spread crumbs under the box and wait behind a bush When the bird comes he sees the crumbs and goes under to pick the crumbs This is your chance to catch him Pull the string and the box falls on him

4427947/4360286/4463234.title: Toys and Games
4427947/4360286/4463234.text:
Some children in this district make a lot of small toys, such as timber tops, small guns, whistles, paper boats and dolls.In Summer time, the little girls make chains, wreaths and necklaces out of daisies. They make dolls with old pieces of cloth stuffed with paper. They also make paper boats, ships and boxes and other small toys.The boys make timber tops, whistles and guns. They make
(continues on next page)

4428064/4374316/4464560.title: Homemade Toys
4428064/4374316/4464560.text: The way we make a skate is, we get a board and we put wheels on it. Then we go  on it and shove it along with a stick. The way we make a kite is we plaster paper on a light bit of a stick and we tie it on to a spool of thread and it will go up out of sight in the air. We make snares for catching rabbits out of thin wire. First we put a curve on the top of the wire. ThThen we put the other end into the curve and we set it at a rabbits burrow. Then when the rabbit runs out the wire will tighten around him and hold him.

4428064/4374338/4464638.title: Homemade Toys
4428064/4374338/4464638.text:
The way we make a toy motor car is we get a big box and put four wheels on it. Then we get an iron and put it through the front of the box and join it to the axle of the wheel. That is the steering wheel.	The way we make a kite is to get a rod and join the two ends of it together. Then we get another stick and put it in the middle. We put a piece of paper round the rods and tie them with a string and let it go up in the air.	The way we make a top is to get a spool
(continues on next page)

4427968/4362392/4466068.title: Homemade Toys
4427968/4362392/4466068.text:
In olden times toys were made of little things. Children put two sticks in a potato for a doll. Then they used to make a dress to cover the potato and the sticks. Girls make string flower together, and they make them into wreeds. Boys make tops from empty spools. They pared it at one end. Boys make guns from trees. A branch is cut. Then a hole is cut in the middle of it. They put a spring from a clock into it and the gun was made.Boys also make cradle- birds  to catch wild birds. They get a flag  and three rods. One rod is put at the bottom for the bird  to stand on and  and another between the two. Children make carts also from two boards about six inches and two lids of boxes are nailed on to each side. Children also amuse themselves by getting a "tráithnín" and whistling into it. By making housings at the side of the wall and putting dicings into it children amuse
(continues on next page)

4428055/4373168/4466072.title: Homemade Toys
4428055/4373168/4466072.text:
All boys and girls love playing with toys and they also get great pleasure in making them.Around here girls and boys make their own toys. When a girl wants a doll she makes it. She gets a few pieces of sticks, a nice round potatoe, and a few rags and strings, and a nice piece of material which her mother had left over after making a suit or a dress or something of the kind. She sticks the potatoe on one end of the stick, lower down she joins a cross stick for hands with strings. She fastens two sticks on the end of the center stick for legs. She rolls rags on the centre stick for the body, and she rolls some on the hands and legs and stitches them down firmly. She puts a white clean cloth on the head and paints the front with a pencil and ink. For
(continues on next page)

4428016/4368374/4471620.title: Homemade Toys
4428016/4368374/4471620.text: Daisy Chains. The girls in this district make daisy chains in Summer. They gather a number of daisies, bore a hole in the stem of one and pull the stem of a second out through, this is continued for the length required. Some of the children are fond of making daisy chains to decorate a statue of the Blessed Virgin which we have in the school.Home Made DollsI often made dolls at home. First I got some coloured cloth and hay. I cut out the shape of the doll's feet, hands body and head in the cloth. Then I sewed them up and stuffed them with hay. Next I sewed the feet and hands on to the body. From two round pieces of cloth I made the head. For the face I sewed on a piece of white cardboard, marked on it in black pencil two dots for eyes, a dot for a nose, a long line for the mouth, slanted strokes over the eye for eyebrows. Then I dressed the doll with a silk frock made from small pieces. A doll like this is very useful for when you let her fall she will not break.This was written by Peggie Lydon. Thornhill.

4428016/4368375/4471622.title: Homemade Toys - How a Popgun Is Made
4428016/4368375/4471622.text: How a pop-gun is madeA piece of stick generally hazel or sally is cut about a foot in length. A hole is bored right through from top to bottom leaving the outer covering like a shell.A second piece is pared thin enough to go through the first while a thick portion left at one end to serve as a handle. A tiny piece of raw potato is placed and one end of the outer stick and shoved down to the mouth. A second piece of the potato is left at the opening. The handle is pushed through, the pressure then exerted on the air between the two pieces of potato causes the first to shoot out making the "pop" noise children love so well. Sometimes they shoot water from the pop-gun. This they do by tying a piece of woollen thread on to the handle and soaking it in water. When forcing the air out through the gun the water shoots out with it a long distance.This description was written by Johnnie Gill Sla. VI Tournhill, Co. Mayo.

4428016/4368376/4471624.title: Homemade Toys - How a Catapult Is Made
4428016/4368376/4471624.text: [Diagram of catapult included in the text]To make a catapult you require two strips of rubber generally parts of an old tyre, a piece of leather - the tongue of an old shoe is most suitable - and a forked branch of a tree. The rubber bands are about an inch in thickness. They are tied to keep each branch and again to the piece of leath in the centre. To work the catapult place a stone in the piece of leather. Hold the leather into your face then pull the piece of rubber. A Cradle BirdSee next page
4428016/4368376/4471624.school_info: School: Clochar na Trócaire, Leac an Anfa, Cathair na Mart

4428016/4368377/4471625.title: Homemade Toys - Cradle Birds
4428016/4368377/4471625.text: These are made from strong and fine sticks and are woven together. The cradle is cone-shaped with the bottom rod circular in shape and the others in a slanting direction up from it tapering to a point. Between these thin rods sally or osier are woven in and out just like the weaving in a basket. The cradle is used in frosty or snowy weather. It is placed near the dwelling-house convenient to a window. It is raised up a little from the ground by means of a stick to which a long twine is attached. Crumbs, meal or such like food are left under the cradle. When the bird comes along he runs in and commences to pick the food. Meantime the boy who sets the trap has the end of the twine farthest from the cradle gripped in his hand. He pulls, the stick comes with him and down falls the cradle trapping the bird in side.

4428016/4368378/4471628.title: Homemade Toys - How to Make a Snare
4428016/4368378/4471628.text: A snare is made in the following way. Get three strings of snare wire (this is thin wire something like that used in bead-threading, it is sold for a penny or twopence per roll). Bind the three strings together - plait them - so as to make one fairly strong string. Next cut a number of sticks short but fairly thick and fix them into the ground a few feet apart. Tie one end of the snare firmly round the post. Make a loop at the other end about the width of your finger, this helps to catch the rabbit quickly. The snares must be set low down in the ground. When the rabbit hops along he catches his foot in the loop and is held there. It is necessary to have the little posts fastened well in the ground, otherwise the rabbit could easily bring all with him. The constant tugging to try and free himself, helps instead to tighten the wire round the foot.

4428021/4368706/4474331.title: Homemade Toys
4428021/4368706/4474331.text: The boys and girls of this district find amusement making toys in spare time.  The girls make a crown of daisies by tying alot of them together with a string.   The boys made tops and whistles from thread spools.

4428026/4369316/4474639.title: Toys
4428026/4369316/4474639.text: A blade of grass makes a bugle by placing it between the thumb with the palms of the hands together and blowing on it.A "catapult" can be made with a piece of sally rod bent and tied at each end with a string to make the bow.A light piece of rod makes the dart.A flag leaf makes a small boat.Rushes makes a "fools" hat or cap.A young maiden toys with a daisy to ascertain if her admirers lover her. She starts picking off the petals at the (second) first one she says "he loves me" at the second "he loves me not" and so on till it comes to the last petal and that is the dreading factor.

4428026/4369327/4474681.title: Homemade Toys
4428026/4369327/4474681.text:
Making BirdcradlesA square flame is made by nailing four thin boards in the form of a square. Then four shorter sticks are nailed over these making the cradle higher and narrower. This is carried on until the cradle is finished.A fork kind of bramble without any knots and a thick sallyrod and a weak sallyrod are then got. By means of these sticks the birdscradle is set and when a bird sees the crumbs and worms which are placed in under the cradle he is enticed to enter it. The thick sallyrod which also serves as a perch is also a springy tongue. When the bird stands on this tongue the cradle falls over him and he is caught unharmed.Bow and Arrow.A springy sallyrod or a hazel stick with a piece of strong cord tied on each end is a bow and a light stick is used as an arrow. The arrow is pulled back by means of the cord and then let
(continues on next page)

4428026/4369329/4474683.title: Toys
4428026/4369329/4474683.text:
Bow and ArrowThe "Bow and arrow" are made by getting a rod and making a semicircle of it by trying a string to each end of the rod. Then there is another rod got and when the string is tightened the latter rod shoots away.Bird CradleThe Bird Cradle is made out of garden rods. First there is a square frame made (The rods are then built on the frame) Then there is wire tied on one of the corners and also tied on the opposite corner. The rods are then built on the frame. There is a tongue put in it then. It is then set by means of a tricker and fork. When the bird goes in picking the worms she hops on the tongue. The tongue falls towards the ground. The cradle falls and the bird is caught.
(continues on next page)

4428028/4369800/4476976.title: Toys etc Made by Children of Killeen National School
4428028/4369800/4476976.text:
A SnareI get horse hair and I put about twenty ribs together and put a knot on the end. Then I open into two parts. Then I put two of my fingers in the ashes and twist one across the other. I keep doing that till the snare is finished.A SlingI get a bit of an old shoe and I cut it about an inch and a half long and an inch and a half long and an inch wide. Then I bore a hole in each end and I put a sling in each hole
(continues on next page)

4428259/4389152/4477225.title: Homemade Toys
4428259/4389152/4477225.text:
Every boy or girl finds some amusement in making toys.It is not so long ago since I saw a cliabhain made.First four strong sallies are procured. There are holes bored in two of them and the other two sticks are pointed at each end. The four are placed on the ground to form a square and the pointed ends are put into the holes. In this way the frame is kept together. Four double sally rods are placed round the corners and the ends of them tied together. It is built up with more slender rods, the ends of which rest on each other, and when completed it is like a tent at the top.A sally rod is now procured and bent into a half circle the ends of which are placed in two corner of the frame.A forked stick is left resting against the cliabhain (?). The crooked part of the trigger is put between the forks and the other part of it is put inside the half circle. When a bird wants to get the bread it has to touch (?) the half circle before getting inside it. The half circle moves the trigger which makes the forked stick fall. The
(continues on next page)

4428265/4389701/4477936.title: Homemade Toys
4428265/4389701/4477936.text:
When girls are stringing daisies they pull a bunch of them and make a hole in the stem of one and put another one through it and go until they have made a chain. They wear them for a necklace.When the thread is finished on spools the boys often make “spinning jennys” out of them [sic] They cut the spool in two halves and make a sharp point on each of them and put a bit of a stick through the hole in the spool and then they have “the spinning jennys.” They spin them on the floor.When I am making a “claven” or cradle bird I cut rods. I make a square bottom with four thin boards and I put a thin rod up from each corner and then put other rods in between them and tie them with string. I put a thin rod in the inside of it. I set the “claven” on the ground and put a handful of corn or some other food under it. The birds go in to eat the food and they hop up on the stick and the “claven” falls down and they are under it and can’t get out.When I am making snares I get snare wire and cut about six feet off it for one snare and I put four ply in it. I twist the wire together with a pot lid. When I have made the snares I cut a stick and tie the snare to it.
(continues on next page)

4428267/4390052/4478826.title: Homemade Toys
4428267/4390052/4478826.text: Tops:- Get a thread-spool and cut it into two pieces.  Then put a piece of stick through it.  That is what you call a Top or Spinning Jenny.Turnip-models:- Get a turnip and cut the middle out of it and leave it the shape of a man’s face.  Light a candle inside, and put a piece of red paper on the front of it and you would think it was a man’s face that was looking at you.Guns:- Vut a piece of a boortree branch and take the soft middle out of it.  Then you make a ramrod out of another stick.  The pullets are made of paper. Bow-and-Arrow:- Put three ribs of an old umbrella together, tied with a cord.  Then you get another rib and sharpen it, which serves as a dart.

4428267/4390053/4478827.title: Homemade Toys
4428267/4390053/4478827.text: A Moneybox:- The way to make a moneybox is to get a cocoa tin and make a hole at the top of the tin about the shape of a penni or a halfcrown.A Catapult:- is made from a sallyrod about two feet in length and bent so that both ends of the rod will almost meet.  After that get a piece of rubber and tie it around the rod.  Get a small stone and tie it on to the rubber.  After that pull back the rubber and the stone will fly away for a certain distance.A Pipe:- The way to make a pipe is to get a spool and bore a hole on the side of the spool with a red-hot knitting needle.  Then get a piece of boortree and make a hole through the middle of the piece of stick.  This stick will serve as a shank.  Put the shank into the hole on the end of the spool, and that is all that has to be done in making the pipe.A Whistle:- a whistle is made with a piece of sycamore tree.  Cut a hole at the head of the wood.  This is all that is required in making a whistle.

4428267/4390054/4478829.title: Homemade Toys
4428267/4390054/4478829.text: A Whistle:- This is the way to make a whistle.   Get an [?] that grows in the meadow and cut it short.  Make a hole in the middle of it and it will whistle.Bow and Arrow:- This is the way to make a Bow and Arrow.  Get a piece of board and bore a hole in it.  The get a rib of an old umbrella and put it through.  Tie a string on the two ends of the (string) rib.  Cut a nick in the board and put the cord down into it.  Set a bit of a pointed stick on the middle of the board.  Raise the string with your finger and away goes the stick.

4428288/4392002/4478888.title: Toys and Pastimes
4428288/4392002/4478888.text: Boys and girls nowadays enjoy playing with toys and making them as a pastime as boys and girls of long ago used to do.The girl make wreaths of flowers, chains of daisies, or they make dolls, dolls dresses, or they shape things from paper.In summer when all the flowers are in bloom, I usually pass the time by making wreaths of flowers, chains of daisies and by pulling wild flowers. When chains of daisies are being made, holes are made in the stems of the flowers, and then one stem is linked in the other until the chain is as large as a necklace.But boys have different pastimes from the girls such as: making tops from wood or turnips, making creels from rods for catching blackbirds and thrushes, making snares for entrapping rabbits, ball playing, and various other pastimes.

4481805/4408614/4481849.title: Toy-Making at Home
4481805/4408614/4481849.text: Some of the toys that used to be made at home in days gone by were:- a spinning top and a cats cradle.A spinning top was made by cutting a spool, sharping one end, and pushing a stick (also sharpened at one end like a pencil) through the hole in the centre of the spool. These tops spin very well on a table or plate. Sometimes they are still made to amuse children.A cats cradle can be made from a number of rushes twisted in and out through each other and made into a long round shape.Another of our famous home made toy was a spool with four nails driven into it: Woolen yarn can be knitted over the tops of the nails and through the hole.

4481805/4408615/4481851.title: Toy-Making at Home
4481805/4408615/4481851.text: A home-made toy is made from a certain reed which grows along the ditches and is called a whistle. It is made by cutting a little piece out of the top near the end and inserting a little piece of another reed in the end and then the whistle is finished.Another toy is made from the same kind of reed, is called a pea-shooter, and is made in this way:- a piece of reed is cut a certain length and then it is ready.

4486498/4414713/4486672.title: Homemade Toys - Rag Dolls
4486498/4414713/4486672.text: 20-1-38We have more toys now than the boys and girls had fifty years ago. They had to make them themselves and we get the most of them to buy now. I often made a rag doll.To make a rag doll, you would get a piece of cotton and split it up a bit for two legs and sew the legs up. Then stuff them with rags. When you would get the legs stuffed on, you would sew the cotton up both sides and stuff it well. When you would get that done you would tie a cord around its neck. Then you would sew up the head a bit and stuff it. Then you would get enough stuffing in it, you sew it all up.Then you would put two blots of ink on the face for the two eyes and another blot of ink for the nose under the eyes, and another long blot of ink for the mouth. The you would have the doll completed.Carrie MooreGlenmaquinLetterkenny

4486498/4414714/4486723.title: Homemade Toys - How to Make a Necklace of Daisies
4486498/4414714/4486723.text: You gather a lot of daisies together, then you make a hole in the stock of the daisy and put the end of the stock of another daisy into the hole. So you continue on like that till you have a long chain made.Another way of making a daisy chains is to break the stocks off the daisies and leave the heads. Then you get a needle and thread and place the needle through the centre of the daisy till you have the thread filled. This makes a nice necklace.

4486498/4414715/4486728.title: Local Homemade Toys - A Plug Gun
4486498/4414715/4486728.text:
This is how to make a plug gun. First you get a piece of a Country stick and make a hole in it with a hot iron. Then you get a thinner stick which is used as a ramrod and you plug the hole with paper. Then you put down the thin stick through the hole and push out the paper. It lets a big shot. I made a plug gun often.



I often saw some home made toys. Here are some of them: A spinning top and a bow and arrow and a plug gun. Here is the way you make a spinning top. First you get a finished spool and you cut it in two and you can make a spinning top out of either sides. There is a hole through it in all and you put a piece of a pointed stick through the hole and then the top is made.

4486498/4414715/4486729.title: Local Homemade Toys - A Plug Gun
4486498/4414715/4486729.text:
This is how to make a plug gun. First you get a piece of a Country stick and make a hole in it with a hot iron. Then you get a thinner stick which is used as a ramrod and you plug the hole with paper. Then you put down the thin stick through the hole and push out the paper. It lets a big shot. I made a plug gun often.



I often saw some home made toys. Here are some of them: A spinning top and a bow and arrow and a plug gun. Here is the way you make a spinning top. First you get a finished spool and you cut it in two and you can make a spinning top out of either sides. There is a hole through it in all and you put a piece of a pointed stick through the hole and then the top is made.

4486498/4414716/4486774.title: Homemade Toys
4486498/4414716/4486774.text: This is the name of some home made toys: The plug gun and the bow and arrown and the swize and the yoo-yoo and the tops and the sword.The swize is made from a tin lid. The lid has to be nicked round and two holes put in it. Then a cord is put through the holes and tied. Then the toys is made. When you pull the cord the swize runs round and makes a noise like a bee.I often made a swize

4497913/4344902/4497930.title: Homemade Toys
4497913/4344902/4497930.text:
The children nowadays spend much time in amusing themselves in making toys. One of our common toys which all girls, and boys spend much time at making is a pop-gun. It is a piece of bore-tree about six inches long. It is all boast inside, and you have to take every bit of this boast stuff out, and put a cork at each end of the piece of bore-tree. You are to have also a ram-rod, and pare it very good. Leave a small bit at the end without paring so that when you are going shooting you put in the ram rod as far as the big thick piece, and then you shoot out the first cork
(continues on next page)

4428169/4383430/4498219.title: Homemade Toys
4428169/4383430/4498219.text:
Girls make chains or girdles with flowers. They use a needle and thread. Daisies and buttercups are most commonly used. Then they cut the stems off the flowers using the heads to make into a chain or girdle. Each head is threaded into a cord with a needle. This makes a very nice chain or girdle.Dolls can be made with flowers for instance with a poppy by cutting the stems two or four inches long to represent the legs. The petal is turned down A strand of grass is tied around the middle of the petal in this way forming the skirt and bodice of a dress. Then another stem four inches long is cut for the arms. This stem is attached through the petal and the doll is now complete. It is called a black doll with red dress and black head and face.Boys make toys with thread spools by cutting the spool to form a point. Then they get a nail about two and a half inches long which is put through the hole in the spool. This forms the spike. The toy is then complete.Boys make pea shooters from elder branches. First the branch is cut about six inches long. Then a thick steel knitting is got. it is put in the fire till
(continues on next page)

4428169/4383432/4498220.title: Homemade Toys
4428169/4383432/4498220.text:
Many boys and girls find great amusement in making toys in spare time. In Summer the girls pick daisies in the fields, they string them together and make necklaces and bracelets out of them. They also make crowns for their hair out of the big dog daisies. In Summer they also make necklaces and bracelets from shells which they gather on the strand.In the Winter evenings girls collect a pile of the tinsel paper off cigarette packets. They make beautiful belts and bracelets from it. They fasten a buckle on the belt with fine wire, and it is worn with light frocks in the Summer.In the olden times the girls made dolls from old black stockings. They stuffed them with any old bits of rags. They put shoe buttons for eyes. They sewed white thread for a nose and red thread for a mouth and used wool to make hair. They made a car for the doll out of an old wooden box. They got empty polish tins and bored holes in them. They put them on the box for wheels. They got two long pieces of wood nailed one on each side of the box to form handles.
(continues on next page)

4498256/4383812/4498258.title: Homemade Toys
4498256/4383812/4498258.text:
The boys (and men) of Skerries are very fond of making little boats with corks, a slender rod and some feathers.First, they take three corks, and pass the rod through them lengthwise leaving a space of about an inch and a half in between the corks.They then stick a feather in each cork, as a sail.If the "boat" is inclined to capsize, a light stone is suspended by means of a cord passed through the middle cork. This, if at all possible, is to be avoided as it somewhat mars the speed of the "boat".A very favourite toy in Skerries is the catapult.Boys procure the tube from a motor car tire; and from this cut a long narrow strip. They next get a forked stick and after cutting the rubber in the centre and inserting a circular piece of leather, affix the ends of the rubber to the fork, and the catapult is ready for use.
(continues on next page)

4498277/4383669/4498283.title: Homemade Toys
4498277/4383669/4498283.text: Home-Made ToysLong ago there were no toys as there are today. Toys are very amusing; they pass the time away playing with them. In summer children go out and make daisy chains. They cut the stems off and get a long piece of straw and put it in the petals of the daisy. [graphic example Daisy chain]Rag dolls are very amusing. Some children get a lot of rags and put them together and tie a piece of string around the waist of them. They get a piece of paper and roll it into a round ball then they get a pencil and mark the eyes, nose, and mouth. (graphic example: Rag doll]. Some boys get a spool and put a match in the middle of it and put it spinning round. [graphic example: top]. Boys get turnips and scoop holes in them for eyes and a v nose and mouth. [graphic example; turnip]. Boys get a branch of an elder and bend it then they get a catapult and put it in it then it is a gun.Kathleen McArdle 7 December 1937

4498347/4383974/4498363.title: Homemade Toys
4498347/4383974/4498363.text:
Long ago people used to make their own toys.  Ways in which to trap birds and rabbits were found by them.  The people would place a large box outside a window.  Hanging from the top of this box was a piece of wood from which a large piece of string was attached.This string was put in through the open window and a person would hold this and watch for his opportunity.  A slice of bread or meat was placed on the box and when the bird would come to eat it the person from inside the window would pull the string and
(continues on next page)

4498689/4385427/4498708.title: Homemade Toys
4498689/4385427/4498708.text:
Home-Made Toys.June 14th; 1938.One home made toy is a cliavawn used for catching birds in winter. Two make the cliavawn elder sticks are required, cut four pieces about fifteen inches long, place them in the shape of a square tie each corner with a double card, bring the four cards to a point about a foot high and start to build from the bottom, placing the sticks through the cords.  Every lair gets shorter until you reach the top.  Then twist the cords with a small stick to tighten
(continues on next page)

4498689/4385429/4498709.title: Homemade Toys
4498689/4385429/4498709.text:
Home-Made ToysJune 14th; 1938.There are a great number of home-made toys.  I am going to describe some of them.  My father made a toy pig from a lemon.  He put two heads ofmatches to make his legs and one match for his tail.There is a water-weed by which musical instruments can be made.  There is no centre in these weeds.  You can make a fife from them by boring one
(continues on next page)

4498820/4385747/4498824.title: Toys We Play With
4498820/4385747/4498824.text:
Toys We Play WithWe Kinsealy boys are very active. We make a lot of our games and toys. The boys make a lot of bows and arrows and especially fishing rods, which they make in the summer. Now I shall tell you the way to make a fishing rod and how to fish.In the summer we go through the fields, secking good straight sticks to make rods. Next we to Dublin and buy a line and hook. We tie the line to the rod and put a cork on the line at what depth we want it.We go to the lake or pond and make a successful days fishing with our new fishing rod. We make our bait from flour and water. The fishing is carried on most in the summer. Another of our games are skittles which we make from a stick also.We go through the fields an get eight bits of sticks. Then we get a larger bit which is called the king. We come home and put the eight soldiers in a ring and put the king in the middle. Then we get two marbles and stand twenty feet away.  We throw the marbles at the skittles and try to knock the latter down. The person that knocks the most down is the winner of the game. The game is played mostly in January and February. Some other day I might tell you more of the games that we Kinsealy boys make.
(continues on next page)

4498008/4345327/4500821.title: Homemade Toys
4498008/4345327/4500821.text: Some small girls occupy their leisure time by making necklaces out of the heads of daisies. They procure a needle and a long piece of thread. At one end of the thread a knot is put in order to stop the heads from falling off. Forty or fifty heads of daisies are sufficient to make a necklace.Necklaces are also made out of red berries which are to be found on wild rosebushes. They are treated in a similar way to the heads of daisies, but a stronger needle and thread are required. Sometimes the little girls knot the ends together and put the necklace round their necks.
4498008/4345327/4500821.school_info: School: N. Breandáin, Cathair na Mart

4428085/4376605/4502434.title: Local Games and Toys
4428085/4376605/4502434.text:
Local Games and ToysLong ago the people used to play many games such as hunting, playing marbles and pitch and toss.A number of scholars used to join hands together and chase one scholar until they would catch her.The people used to have great sport playing marbles.  They used put a number of marbles into a ring and try to knock them out by a larger marble call the taw.Long ago the people used to have great value for buttons because they used to play the came called pitch and toss with them.  Everyone used to pitch up two buttons each to a stone called the bob.  The person that would put his button nearest to the bob would toss one button belonging to every person on the tosser.  One side of the button is called the head and the other side the harp.  If the side called the head would be on all the buttons when they would fall down one the ground the person that tossed them could keep all the buttons.  If the side called the harp would be on the buttons the person that would come second in the pitching would toss them and so forth until
(continues on next page)

4428086/4376757/4503246.title: Homemade Toys
4428086/4376757/4503246.text: Long ago people used to make guns for shooting water. This is how they are made: - first a stick is got which is without anything inside in it. Then a small stick is got and a piece of leather knelt on to the top of it. It is pushed out when full of water.Cage-MakingA cradle is made with twigs. Then a piece of a board is got and a piece of a stick. The stick is placed in the middle and a piece of bread. Then a board is placed on the sticks. The bird touched the stick and the board falls and she is caught.Lantern-MakingA jam-pot is got and a piece of cardboard is pout int he bottom of it; a candle is then got and placed int he bottom. The candle is lit: then it is a nice light.

4428086/4376758/4503249.title: Homemade Toys
4428086/4376758/4503249.text: Girls make necklaces in the summer with daisies. Firstly they get a string and a needle and sow daisies together until they have a necklace made.Lamps were not made long ago but they used to break the bottom off a bottle and turn the bottle upside down. Then they would get a candle and put it in the bottle and light it.Water-guns were made from an alder branch. Firstly the middle should be taken out of the stick. Then a stick should be found to fit in the middle of the other one. Then water should be put into the gun and by pushing the middle stick it would throw out the water.Spinning tops were made by pointing a stick and putting prints in the top for the cord. Children made little boats out of boards, they would shape the boards in the shape of a boat. Then they would put them out on the water to swim.

4428086/4376759/4503251.title: Homemade Toys
4428086/4376759/4503251.text:
Many toys are made in my district. A cradle is made to catch birds. Firstly things are got and a little cradle is made. They are made mostly in winter time when the birds are hungry. The cradle is placed in a field and bread is put into it. A piece of board is got and a piece of elastic is attached to it. A tack is got and driven a little though the board. The bird comes and kicks the tack and the board shoots up and she is inside then.A lamp is made out of a jam mug, by getting a small turnip and holing it. Then it is placed in the mug and a candle is placed in the turnip. Sometimes dolls are made by getting a piece of cloth and sewing it. Then bran is got and it is filled with bran. A cord is got and the cloth is tied and a head is made. A pencil is got and eyes are made.Flogging top may be made by getting a piece of timber and (k) making it around. A boot nail is got and put into the top of the timber. Then the top is made.A whistle may be made out of chestnut by holing the top of it. Then you could blow into it.
(continues on next page)

4428086/4376760/4503270.title: Homemade Toys
4428086/4376760/4503270.text:
(continued from previous page)
[-]



The way to make a snake is. - Firstly you must go to the shopkeeper and but some snare wire. Then you will cut six wires and have them about one foot and a half long. Put them together and twist them. Then you must tie a twine to the wire and the snare is made.Girls find it great fun to make a daisy chain. The way it is done is:- You would gather a certain amount of daises. Then you would put a hole in one and slip another one through it and so on until you will have them all used. The way they used to make whistles long ago was:- Get the skin of a horse chestnut tree and put a split on it like whistles nowadays. Then get a small bit of a stick and slip it into it and the whistle is made. To make a pop gun a branch of
(continues on next page)

4428087/4376916/4504414.title: Homemade Toys
4428087/4376916/4504414.text:
Home made ToysBoys and girls find great amusement in making toys.  The girls make daisy chains by putting a slit in the stem of the daisy and putting another daisy through the slit and then another daisy into the second slit and so on until it is long enough for their taste.  girls also make rag dolls by getting all kinds of coloured rags having a white rag for the face and ting a piece of a string as a neck and stuffing the body and legs with straw.the boys used to make pop-guns by getting a piece of an elder branch, the pith which is very soft should be removed, the piece of elder should be about six inches long.  Then a ram-rod is got to fit the elder case, any piece of think stick will do.An inch of the ran-rod is left unskinned.  Then two pieces of paper are got, one is placed in halfway in the top of the pop gun, another is placed at the end, then a violent jerk is given to the ran-rod releasing the bullet with a loud plop.Many boys amuse themselves by making cradles to catch birds, this was commonly done in my district long ago and even today boys at their leisure are always making cradles and snares to catch birds.  Birds cribs may be made by getting four
(continues on next page)

4428087/4376918/4504420.title: Homemade Toys
4428087/4376918/4504420.text:
In Spring or Summer time when the daisies appear, girls go out in the fields to pick them to make necklaces. They pluck the heads of the daisies and sew them together in the centre with a needle and thread.Children also make dolls of old rags and sticks. They shape the head and shoulders of cloth bags filled with sawdust or leaves. The top part is for the doll's head and the lower part is for the body. They make the hands and legs of sticks and put an old coat on the doll and make hair with shavings for her head. They play with her then and find great amusement with their rag doll.Boys, when making tops, cut a piece of holly wood and work it with a knife and chisel, until they have it shaped like a top. Then they take it to the forge to get a spear in it.To make a hurley, they cut a piece of ash that is arched like a hurley and work it with a hatchet and plane until they have it made into a proper hurley. They
(continues on next page)

4427808/4346046/4506032.title: Toys and Pastimes
4427808/4346046/4506032.school_info: School: N. Peadair, Caisleán an Bharraigh

4427808/4346048/4506033.title: Toys and Pastimes
4427808/4346048/4506033.text:
There are many ways in which I spend my leisure hours. Whenever I get a big spool I make a top out of it by pairing it until it is in the shape of a cone. Then I get a bit of wood and point it and I put it through the hole. Then I make a whip by cutting a straight stick and by attaching a strip of cloth to it, then I whip until the spike breaks.During the winter I make kites. The way I make it is, I cut two laths off a tea chest, and I make a cross of them. Then I put wire through the four ends of the laths. Across that I sew the cloth of an umbrella and I take strong paper and I sew it. I make a tail out of small bits of paper. I buy sixpence worth of twine and attach it to the kite. When the wind comes I go out on
(continues on next page)
