4742057/4731554/4817099.title: Homemade Toys
4742057/4731554/4817099.text:
There are many toys made at home in this district. There are a great many made for Hallowe'en night. Boys get a large turnip the night before. They get a knife and remove the pulp from the inside leaving only the skin and a piece of the stalk. Then two round holes are cut for the eyes and one square-shaped hole for the mouth. Matches are put in the mouth for teeth. A hole is then made in the stalk and a candle is placed in it. On Hallowe'en. night this is placed in the ditch with the candle lit where a ghost or fairies are supposed to have been seen. People who are superstitious are afraid to go past and often return home without continuing their journey.Traps are also made for catching birds. These are made by getting a riddle, a small piece of
(continues on next page)

4770044/4768761/4818163.title: Toys - A Didgy Doggy
4770044/4768761/4818163.text:
When I was young I made a "Didgy Dodgy". I went out in the field and I gathered cowslips. I broke the stems off the cowslips. Then I tied a piece of thread around the blossoms of the cowslips in the shape of a ball. In some places they are called "Didgy Dodgys" and more places "Toss Balls". The way I played with the "Didgy Dodgy" was I threw it up in the air and when throwing it up in the air I said these words. "Toss Ball, Toss Ball please tell me. How many years have I to go to school. Each time I threw it up that represented one year.
(continues on next page)

4770044/4768762/4818174.title: Toys - A Didgy Doggy
4770044/4768762/4818174.text:
(continued from previous page)
If I threw it up five times and suceeded in catching it coming down but failed to catch it the sixth time that meant I had five years to go to school. If I threw it up ten times and suceeded in cathing it coming down but failed to catch it the eleventh time that meant I had ten years to go to school.

When I was a young girl I always wore a St Patrick's Cross on the 17th of March. It is made from a piece of cardboard round in shape covered over with green paper. There are four pieces of coloured paper generally white, yellow, red and blue, put in the shape of a cross and sown to the cardboard. The piece of cardboard was usually about four inches in diameter.A piece of shamrock was put

When I was young I was very fond of dolls. I often made them myself. I got a white piece of cloth six inches long and four inches wide. I sewed it up both sides and across the bottom. Then I got two pieces of cloth to make arms and two other bit a little longer for the legs. Then I sewed them on when I had them full of sawdust. Then I filled the body with sawdust also. I gathered in the top of the body for the neck. Next I got another piece of white cloth and cut it in a round shape.

Then I sewed it all around and filled it also. I sewed it on between the shoulders. For to put hair on it I generally got the wool of a sheep and stuck it on with pase. For eyes and nose and mouth I put some red ink. Then I dressed in in baby's clothes and carried it and wheeled it about. I always brought it to bed with me for I would not sleep without it.



A catapult is a toy generally used by boys. It is very easily made. First get a piece of leather about two inches long. Make a hole in each end of the leather. Then get two strings one longer than the other and tie them to the leather.

4770044/4768769/4818230.text:

It is used for throwing stones. Tie the long piece around your hand and put a stone in it. Catch the short string in your hand. Then swing it around, then let the short one go. It is able to send the stone a long distance.



When I was young I usually had a doll. I often made a bed for her. First I got four pieces of card-board. I stitched them together with very strong thread. Those two pieces of card-board are supposed to be one end of the bed and one side. Then I got two more pieces for the other end and the other side of the bed. Then I got one big flat piece of card-

Then I filled it with sawdust. Then I made sheets and blankets. I put the doll into the bed then. I pretended she was asleep in bed. The bag with sawdust in it was the mattress.

4770044/4768787/4818274.text:

I put the needle through the middle of each red berry. When I had all the berries on the thread, I fastened it at each end. I put it around my neck then and wore it as a necklace.

When I was young I often made a peashooter out of Fowrawn. The Fowrawn is a plant that grows in the ditches in fields. It grows very tall and when it withers in winter a long hollow grey coloured stem remained. The stem has crevasses on it running from top to bottom. 4742163/4741167/4819869.title: Homemade Toys
4742163/4741167/4819869.text:
Home Made Toys.In Summer the little girls make daisy chains. The little girls also make rag dolls and clothes for dolls.To make the rag dolls we get a piece of calico, make it into a little round bag, fill the bag with saw-dust or rags, close up the bag and then with a pen and ink draw the face. We make the body hands and feet from rags. Sometimes we put a cap on the head and at other times we stitch brown wool on the head.The boys make cribs for catching birds. They make them from sallies. (1) They get three sticks and tie them together. (2) They then spread a number of other sticks over these. (3) They weave a third
(continues on next page)

4798656/4787479/4822463.title: Homemade Toys
4798656/4787479/4822463.text: Toys are mostly made during the Christmas.A bow and arrow is made, by getting a piece of round timber.  A hole is bored in the timber, so that a little rod will pass through.  A piece of rubber is then attached to the end of the timber, so that when pulled, it will send off the rod, used as ammunition.Sometimes a target is got, and this is made by putting a potato on the top of a stick, sunk in the ground.A bird-cradle, is made with 'sally' rods, like a basket.  A piece of bread is put under it.  Then a  little stick is placed under it, to lift it up.  When a bird eats the bread, she will throw the stick and this way be trapped under it.

4798656/4787480/4822467.title: Homemade Toys
4798656/4787480/4822467.text:
Tops are made in this district out of spools. Birdcradles are made for trapping birds out of sallyrods and bourtree.  First a square made of four strong sticks is made.  Then each 'sally' rod is bent in two and put at each end of the square and tied at the top.  Then bits of bourtrees are put on each side till the cradle is built to the top.  After each row the rods are tied with strings.  When it is made another sallyrod is got and put at two ends of the birdcradles.  Then a stick with two branches on the top of it is got, together with a little bit of a rod.  The birdcradle is set in such a way that when the bird hops on it she will be caught.  The birds will not come into it except in frosty or snowy weather.  Some food such as bread is put in it to induce the bird to come in.Toy guns are
(continues on next page)

4427943/4359710/4822539.title: Homemade Toys - A Turnip
4427943/4359710/4822539.text:
A TurnipGet a turnip, cut it in halves, and shape a man's face on it.  I could also cut six of the letter H and join them together again, and I could cut a figure to resemble the face of a person.Folding PaperThe following articles are made by folding paper, a purse, sugarbox, clown's hat, toy-boat.Maggie MulroyBallyvary



The following articles are made by folding paper, a purse, sugarlox, clown's har, toy-boat.

4427943/4359708/4822540.title: Homemade Toys - Daisy Chain
4427943/4359708/4822540.text:
Daisy ChainTo make a daisy chain one would have to get some daisies, a needle and thread.  Pull the stems off the daisies. Put the daisies on the needle and let them slip down to the end of the thread.  When it is long enough the needle is cut from the thread.  Tie the two ends of the thread together.DollMy grandaunt told me when she was small she played with a doll.  This is how she made her doll.  She got a potato, a turnip and some timber.  She put the timber through the potato and the turnip but it was not to appear at either end.  She put a stick each side side of the turnip for hands and two sticks under the turnip for legs.  Celine Warde



My grandaunt told me when she was small she played with a doll. This is how she made her doll. She got a potato, a turnip and some timber. She put the timber through the potato and the turnip but it was not to appear at either end. She put a stick each side side of the turnip for hands and two sticks under the turnip for legs.

4798666/4788480/4823813.title: Homemade Toys
4798666/4788480/4823813.text:
Every boy would like to have a bird in a cage and when the birds build their nests boys search for these and if they find birds in them they are almost sure to take one or two of them home. If they have not cages they may put them in boxes, but there are few boys who have not a cage of some sort. Many make the cages themselves and some buy them in the shops. The home-made cages are made of rods{?} or light sticks and is generally cone-shaped. The bottom is made of wood, and sticks are placed across the inside for the bird to perch on. The cage is fitted with little dishes on which food is placed and there is always a small trough of water there.Bird cradles are also made by boys and they find great pleasure in catching birds with them. When no bird-cradle is to be had they try to catch them with niddles{?]. Birdlure is made from the bark or skin of the holly-tree is often used for catching birds.Fishing rods are made by boys too. They go to the wood and cut a long thin stick and fit it with a line and hook and go to the rivers or lake on Sundays and holidays in summer. The small children make fishing rods from rushes and go to the nearest pond or pool of water and try to catch the small fish that are to be seen there.Whips are made by plaiting rushes and nice handles for these are made from peeling the bark off a nice short stick. The handles are then painted or coloured.
(continues on next page)

4758572/4755842/4922552.title: Homemade Toys
4758572/4755842/4922552.text:
Girls amuse themselves in sunner time by picking daisies and threading them together to make "daisy chains" They then wear the chain around their necks. Boys make whipping tops from spools, cribs from strong twigs to catch birds also snares from wire to catch rabbits. The boys make snares from long horsehairs too.Years ago boys used to make pop-guns from the strong reeds that grow in marshy places. They used to pack the reed at each end with paper which had been chewed previously in the mouth Then a ramrod the width of the inside of the reed was driven quickly through one end. The compressed air in the centre caused the wad of paper to shoot out with a loud report.Girls make pinkeen boxes by plaiting rushes on the finger of the left hand and tying the stems which hang down at
(continues on next page)

4798658/4787901/4922792.title: Homemade Toys
4798658/4787901/4922792.text:
When I was young my mammy used to make woolen balls for us, out of bits of spare wool. She got two round pieces of card-board and put them together and cut a round hole in the centre. Next she threaded a darning needle with a piece of wool and worked round the hole until it was filled up. Then she cut round the edge and tied a string between the two pieces of card-board. It was a nice soft ball when it was finished.Sometimes girls make daisy-chains out of daisies and they put them around their necks
(continues on next page)

4798657/4787669/4923426.title: Homemade Toys
4798657/4787669/4923426.text:
Home-made Toys.We make a top by paring one end of an empty spool of thread as fine as a pen-point, then putting a piece of a stick, pointed very sharply, through the hole of the spool.We make toy guns out of Coltree. We get a thick Coltree stick, and make a hole in the side of it, midway along the length of the stick. We scoop out the middle of the stick, leaving a big hole. Then we procure a piece of plyable steel that will fit into the hole, and we bend this like a trigger, to shoot pebbles out of the hole.I often make a sling by getting a piece of leather and putting holes in each end of it. Then I get two pieces of string and fasten them in the holes. When I want to fire a stone from the sling, I place it in
(continues on next page)

4758578/4756224/4924189.title: Local Cures
4758578/4756224/4924189.text:

feet was a cure for chilblains.Dog BiteWhen a person got a bite from a dog, what the old people said would cure it, was to get a hair from the same dog and tie it around the cut.



4.Sore throatThe cure for a sore throat is to put a woolly stocking around the neck, when going to bed.StingsIf you get a sting of a wasp or a bee, vinegar will take away the pain.BurnsIf a person receives a burn, a leaf called a "sheep's ear", chopped up, and mixed with "hog's lard", will cure it.



Many toys were made by the children in the country long ago, because they very seldom went into the towns, and toys were not manafactured to such an extent as they are now.Boys made many things such as, tops, guns, whistles, bird-cradles, snares, bows & arrows, paper
(continues on next page)

4798699/4791273/4924755.title: Homemade Toys
4798699/4791273/4924755.text:
The kind of toy I make are models out of candle-greace. First a candle is got and it is put into an old saucepan. It is heated over the fire until it is quite soft. It can be formed into any kind of toy. The model I can make best is a top.



The daisys are gathered first then there is a hole in the stem of the daisy and thread another to that one and put a hole in the stem of that one and thread it to another one and so on in the same way. The making if the daisy chains are not gone out of fashion.

4798709/4792292/4925440.title: Homemade Toys
4798709/4792292/4925440.text:
Home-made toys.The young boys and girls in my district at the present day, are very fond of toys. Owing to this when they have spare time, they find great amusement in making their own toys.The principal toys the boys make are, tops, guns, bird-cradles, snares, and slings. The girls mostly make daisy chains and dolls.This is the way the boys make a sling. First they get a bit of leather about five inches long. Then they put two holes at each end of the bit of leather. They put a thin piece of leather about five inches long also into each of these two holes. When this is finished and well done, it is called a sling. The boys use this for throwing stones. Snares are made as follows. First of all some of the boys buy snare wire. Now they twist this wire into little coils, and they leave a loop of the wire resting on the coils. They take the end of the wire, and pull it through the loop. Now they tie the wire to
(continues on next page)

4798709/4792294/4925442.title: Homemade Toys
4798709/4792294/4925442.text:
Home-made ToysIn my district at the present day, boys and girls amuse themselves in making toys, if they have any spare time. The principal toys that are made in my district are tops, slings, snares and bird-cradles and the girles make daisy-chains and dolls.The boys make tops from a spool. They pare the top of the spool until it comes to a point. Then they get a thin stick, point the top of it and put it through the spool. Then the top is made. The sling is another common toy made in my district. The boys get a piece of leather about five inches long. Then they make a hole in each side of the leather and they tie 2 strings of equal length to the leather. Then the sling is made. They get a stone and put it sitting in the piece of leather. Then they whirl the sling in a circle in the air, let go one of the strings and the stone shoots out into the air.Snares are made as follows:- The boys buy what is called snare-
(continues on next page)

4758569/4755587/4925532.title: Homemade Toys
4758569/4755587/4925532.text:
Long ago home made toys were made by every child because they could not buy them. It is often that I made a rag doll. This is how I used to make them. I used to get a salt bag and fill it with old rags. I would then sow up the top. This done I used to get a pencil and make two eyes etc. Then I would fix the neck and sow it.I used to also make little houses out of a large cardboard box. I used to cut windows in both sides of it with a knife , and I would also make a door in it. I would make the furniture out of vim boxes, and boot boxes.Also we used to make dolls prams, cradles, and small beds. For the wheels of the pram we would get old polish boxes, we used to make the handle with a flat stick.Long ago the children used to make necklaces with hips. Daisies were made into long chains I was very found of making daisy necklaces. I used to go sit in a field and pluck daisies with good strong stems. This done I used to sit down and
(continues on next page)

4758569/4755590/4925533.title: Homemade Toys
4758569/4755590/4925533.text:
When making a top they got a lump of wood and shaped it. Then they went to the blacksmiths forge and asked him to make a spear. Sometimes when he would not want to do it he would say he had no spear mouldThe Pop GunThe pop gun was made by the boys also. They used to get a medium sized piece of Alder stick and scooped out the inside. Then they put a cork in one end and a long stick in the other, then they hit they hit the cork out with the stick . I often made one of them myself

4758569/4755597/4925539.title: Homemade Toys
4758569/4755597/4925539.text:
In olden times the children had not the chance of getting toys as they have now. They could not buy them in the shops.Pop gunThe pop gun was made from an elder stick. A hole was made through the stick. A piece of paper is put in one end of the stick. A stick is put in the other end to shoot out the paper. The stick is called the ramrod.KitesA cross was made with a piece of lath. Then it was covered with strong paper. A long piece of twine is tied out of the kite and a tail about four feet long is tied to the end of the kite. The kite is flown on a windy dayBird CribThe crib is to catch birds. It is easier to catch birds in Winter than in Summer. The crib is made from elder sticks. Make a frame with four sticks and four bits of twine. Keep building it until it is finished. Put a briar on the crib for a band. When the bird hops on the briar the crib will fall and catch her.SnaresThe people in this district snare rabbits. They get a copper wire and plait it. Then they make a
(continues on next page)

4798716/4792915/4925739.title: Toy-Making
4798716/4792915/4925739.text: Toy-makingThis is the way I make a top. I first get a spool and cut it in the middle. In the hole that is down through the centre of the spool. I put a small stick with a point at the end of it. The top is then made and ready for spinning. The way I make a catapult is I get two bits of rubber and a forked stick and the tongue of an old boot. I tie the rubber to the forked stick and I tie the two strips of rubber to the tongue of the boot and the catapult is then made.Michael Mullark. Ruskey25 April '38

4798716/4792934/4925777.title: Toy-Making
4798716/4792934/4925777.text: Toy Making.This is the way I make a top. I first get a spool and cut it in the middle. In the hole that is down through the centre of the spool I put a small stick with a point at the top of it. The top is then made and ready for spinning.The way I make a catapult is I get to bits of rubber and a forked stick and the tongue of an old boot. I tie the rubber to the forked stick and I tie the two strips of rubber to the tongue of the boot and the catapult is then made.Mary Moran,Ruskey,Co. Roscommon.25th April '38

4798716/4792963/4925819.title: Homemade Toys
4798716/4792963/4925819.text:
Homemade ToysThis is the way I make sling. I cut the tongue out of a shoe or a boot. Then I bore a little hole at the two ends of the tongue and I put a long twine into one of the holes, and put a short twine into the other hole. Then it is made. This is the way I make a whistle. I cut a bit of stick off a Boer tree, and clean the inside out of it.Then I bore a hole in the stick to blow into, and I put a slit on the end of it. This is the way I make a top.First I get a spool and cut it into two parts. I get a small stick and put it down the hole of one part. It is made then.This is the way I make a catapult. I get a forked stick and tie two strips of rubber on the forked stick.Then I get a tongue of a boot or a shoe and tie it to the rubber. Then it is made. This is another

4798660/4787937/4926165.title: Travelling Folk
4798660/4787937/4926165.text:

In my spare time I often made a doll. This is how I make it. First I get a stiff bit of paper and I make the body. Then I get another bit and I make the head. Then I make the arms and the legs. Then I get a cotton bit of cloth and I cut out the shape of the dress. Then I get my needle and thread and I sew it.I get a pair of knitting needles and I knit a little jumper
(continues on next page)

4798717/4793047/4926210.title: Homemade Toys
4798717/4793047/4926210.text: Boys especially are very fond of making toys.  When my father was a boy the clock got broken and he resolved to make a boat and put propellers on it.  He got two boards about three feet long and fastened them together with sprigs.   Then he got two other and nailed them on for the side.  He put a board at the back and two in the front conical shaped and one at the bottom.  He put on a rudder.He then took the spring out of the clock and put it inside the boat and fastened two sticks, screw shaped on the spring.  He put one sail on it.  He wound the spring and it sailed against the wind at a fast pace.

4798717/4793048/4926278.title: Homemade Toys
4798717/4793048/4926278.text: I often make toys out of wood.  I made a toy cart out of wood and made wheels out of a turnip and put a toy horse drawing it.  I often make a kite out of two pieces of wood, one fourteen inches and the other twelve inches long.  I joined the two peices together with glue and fastened brown paper on to it.  It had a tail five feet long.

4798724/4793580/4926416.title: Homemade Toys
4798724/4793580/4926416.text:
Long ago when there were no toys children had to make their own toys to amuse themselves.Slings.Slings are made by getting some strong twine and a piece of leather.  Tie the twines on each end of the leather.  It will send a stone 40 yds off.Catapult.A catapult is made by getting a forked stick and some rubber.  Tie the rubber on to each end of the forks tightly.  Then get a stone and put it in, and it will send it as far as the sling.Crib.Cribs are made by getting some bole-tree rods.  Bore holes in the rods and fasten them. Then get four thin sally-rods and bend them.  Put them

4798724/4793582/4926422.title: Homemade Toys
4798724/4793582/4926422.text:
In the olden times and even now instead of shooting birds and animals snares, bird cribs, bow and arrows, slings and slaitins were made and set for them.  Many toys were made also kites, necklaces, whistles, bullet guns, tops, titem totems.Snares.Three strands of fine wire were plaited and made into a loop.  It was set at the mouth of the rabit burrow.  When the rabit came he put his head into the loop.  His body not being able to go through the rabit pulled, the loop tightened and the rabit was choked.Bird Cribs.Rods are tied together in the shape of a cradle and when it was set properly birds were caught.  Every child makes these cribs especially in frost or snow and they put a bread crumb or an apple in it which coax the birds.Bow and arrows.It was made with a rod, a board, a twine and a poisened
(continues on next page)

4769959/4762742/4926621.title: Birds
4769959/4762742/4926621.text:
(continued from previous page)
The plovers go up the hills in hard weather and go back to the lowlands in dry weather.  Boys are always told it is a sin to rob a birds nest, and there is special reference to the robbing of a swallows nest.  If this is robbed, the cows will milk blood for three months.



Lanterns have always been made and are still made to provide the children here with toys.  A Turnip is got.  The centre is removed.  A lighted candle is placed inside there.  Sometimes the image of a face is made on the turnip.  The whole appearance when the candle is lit is like an old mans face.Whistles are and were made by taking the centre out of a short stick.  Holes are bored at equal intervals along the stick and it is possible to whistle very well with same.  Sometimes whistles are made out of a song straw, about four inches long.  The straw must have a knot at one end.  A cut is put across the knot like this (-).  A good but easily broken toy.
(continues on next page)

4769959/4762815/4926720.title: Penal Days in this Locality
4769959/4762815/4926720.text:
(continued from previous page)

Rabbits and birds are plentyful there. The Corner of the booreen where the priest was hanged is never tilled. A clump of trees grows around the spot. All the local people assert that it is haunted. Men searching for woodquests and blackbirds at night were terrified by strange noises. A black bull was supposed to be seen. A boy named Phil Rielly of Pluckerstown, Kilmeague Naas, who used this booreen as a short cut to his work had to turn back, as he heard noises in the trees, and there was a strong wind blowing whereas the night was other wise calm.

In olden days, children, instead of buying toys in shops fashioned them according to their own ideas. These toys were very often weapons, for the destruction of birds and game. Many of these toys were made in the Boyle district in bygone days, but here I am about to give a description of toys made by boys of the present time, When catching hares or rabbits peasant boys often used "snares". These consist of pieces of snare-wire, one end of which is formed into a loop, while the other end is fastened to a pointed stick. They are then placed in rabbit-runs which are generally found among long grass. They "eye" is placed exactly in the "run" while the stick is driven into the ground close by. Then, the unfortunate rabbit, when returning to its burrow puts his head through the eye of the snare. On finding the strain at

Top : -  This is made by putting a piece of pointed stick through the hole in a spool and it will spin.Cradlebird : - First of all we get four strong sally rods of the same length and fasten them together in a square. We next fasten four rods of equal length one at each corner of the square and tie them in a point at the top forming four triangles. We get a sally rod and bend it, then we put the ends of it through the cradlebird near the bottom and fasten them there. The centre of this curved rod comes out near the front of the cradlebird. Then we get a forked rod. We hold up the cradlebird slightly and fix there by means of a weak rod which passes through the fork and runs inside the curved sticks. We put

4769983/4763961/4927471.text:
A lot of boys make catapults for killing blackbirds and they make slings too. Neither of these two things is safe to use.Catapults are made out of a fork and rubber and a piece of leather. The fork is made out of a stick. The rubber is got from a motor tube.It is cut into two long thin strips. The leather is cut square. and two holes are put at the sides.The rubber is tied to each grain of the fork The leather is tied to the other ends of the rubber.Slings are made

In olden times boys amused themselves in making toy-guns.Bullet-guns.  They were made of elder branches, cut in lengths five or six inches long and bored.  A ram-rod made of timber was used as a trigger.  Paper was used for making pellets which were put into the gun for firing with.Cribs for catching birds were made from sally rods.  First the frame was made square and the rods cut in lengths.  When these rods were woven about half way the crib was tapered into a narrow point and closed at the top.  A light rod was placed under neath the frame as a bow.  Then the crib was ready for setting in which a

Long ago people always made their own toys.  Girls especially found great pleasure, in this work.  In the long summer days they found great amusement in gathering daisies and making necklaces and girdles.  A hole was made in the stem of the daisy and it was strung by stringing each flower to the stem of the next.  This was continued until a long chain was made.  Sometimes other flowers were mixed in order to beautify the chain.  Often the heads alone were gathered and fastened together by means of a needle and thread.Bird-catching.Birdcatching was a very popular pastime among boys long ago, especially during snowy periods, as birds were easily caught in cold weather.  First of all four sally rods were placed in an upright position in the ground and tied at the top to form a point.  Smaller rods were woven in and out until
(continues on next page)

4798686/4790260/4928352.title: Homemade Toys
4798686/4790260/4928352.text:
Boys spent their spare time making toys.  Long ago they used to make tops from thread spools.  They used to shape the spools into tops and then they drove nails through them so that they could spin them easily.  They kept them spinning by means of whips.  They used to make cradles to catch birds from flat pieces of boards nailed together.  They used to attach pieces of wire to the boards and when the birds would touch the wires they could not get away.The girls spent their time making dolls or stringing flowers together.  They picked the flowers and they tied them together by means of strings.  They made flowers and necklaces from these flowers.Long ago whistles were made by scraping the inside of chestnuts and leaving holes.  When those holes were blown into by anybody there was a loud whistle.  There were  pipes made also from
(continues on next page)

4758550/4753950/4928418.title: Homemade Toys
4758550/4753950/4928418.text:
There is not many home-made toys made around here because mechanical toys are so cheap. The catapult is one which is not being sold in the shops. It can be easily made from two strips of rubber, a fork of a small bough, and a piece of leather. A strip of rubber ten inches long and about ½ inch wide should be tied to the fork. The other end must be tied to the piece of leather by putting a slit about ½ inch wide in the leather and putting the rubber through it. The rubber is doubled up and tied the same is done with the other strip.[Drawing] - Finished catapult
(continues on next page)

4758569/4755589/4928444.title: Homemade Toys
4758569/4755589/4928444.text:
Home Made ToysThe home made toys were made long ago by the boys and girls. One of them is made yet called a popgun. This is how it is made.To get a piece of an elder stick, and bore a hole through it . Get another piece of a stick thin enough to go through the elder. Put a cork in one end then blow into it, and put another cork in the other end. Press the two corks together with the small stick and they will shoot.This is the way to set a night line. Get a piece of line and put a hook on it. Put a piece of lead about a foot from the hook, and put a worm on the hook. Get a pig and tie the line, to it. Then stake it to the bank. In a flood is the best time to set a line. When there are two boys setting the lines they try to be before one another.This is the way to make a fishing rod. To get a fairly thick stick about four foot in length. It must be straight. Then look for a thinner piece than the other. That will stand for the middle. Splice the middle to the boot. 4798732/4794321/4928495.text:
During the long winter nights when the children cannot have anything to do they employ their time making toys. The toys the boys make are tops and bows and arrows. This is how they make them.First they get a piece of leather and two pieces of string. They secure the string at each end of the leather. A pebble is placed in the centre. Going out they fling the string in the direction of the crow. What fun they have when they hear the shrill Caw! Caw! of the crow as the stone reaches her.Another of the toys they make is a top. At first they get a spool and pare it until they have a point on one end. They

4811598/4800495/4929049.title: Local Methods of Catching Wild Birds Long Ago
4811598/4800495/4929049.text:
Many indeed were the ways used to catch birds in this district long ago, before guns or traps were made. These methods were very cheap and very simple. A small bird was caught in a crib or with birdlime. The bird lime was made from linseed oil and resin. This resin was the substance? of larch trees which melts in fine weather. It was soft green matter which was taken off the trees and mixed with linseed oil. It was then fit for use. A cage with a bird in it was left out in a garden and two sticks with bird lime stuck to them were placed near the cage. After some time other birds would perch on the sticks to watch the bird in the cage. Their feet would stick to the sticks and thus they would be caught. Lanterns were also used to catch them. At night people went out into the woods with what was

4769976/4763713/4929208.title: Homemade Toys "Cow-Slip-Ball"
4769976/4763713/4929208.text: This is the way to make a "cow slip ball". Get a bunch of cow slips and a long piece of twine. Tie the twine to two things having it pulled straight. Break off the stalks of the cow-slips and trow them away. Leave the heads of the cow-slips on the twinc the same as a man riding a horse. Do this with all the cow-slips until you have the twine filled. Then tie the two ends of the twine together and pull it tightly. Then the cow-slips-ball is made. The cow-slip-ball is the same as any ordinary ball.

THE LOCAL LANDLORDMatt Hanly was the Landlord over Cronkell. He was a good Landlord. He was born in the locality. He was never married. He evicted two or three people who never many any offer to pay rent. The evicted people went to America. He is living still in Dublin.From: Emily Cox. Cronkell, Ruskey, Dromod

He was there untill eighteen eighty three, the family was settled in the district for generations. The evicted people went to America and to England. Every child finds great amusement in making toys.All children when very small try to make dolls.These dolls are made by straw, old rags, and, pieces of paper.Another toy which boys find great fun in and which they make themselves is a catter - pull.This is made by getting a bit of rubber putting a hole at each end, and putting a string into each hole and join it on to a stick.With this they fire stones, or little pieces of wood.

4811591/4800008/4931880.title: Folklore - Homemade Toys
4811591/4800008/4931880.text: Girls take a flower and put a hole in the middle of the stem and get another flower and put it into the hole made in the first and keep doing that until they have a chain made, and string the top and the end together.    Boys make snares with wire and bits of wood. They twist four or more wires together. They knot the two ends together. Then they get a bit of twine tie it to the bit of wood and add the wire to the twine. They go out to a burrow or run, and dig a hole about the size of the piece of wood and put down the wood in the hole and cover it up.

4742027/4729399/4932909.title: Homemade Toys
4742027/4729399/4932909.text: Many children make toys when they have no money to buy them. They make daisy chains with daisies and a string. They also make necklaces from hips and dolls from rags. First they get some rags and pad it with hay they sew buttons for eyes, then they get a black stick and make the mouth and eyes and dress it up and it appears as a new one. The boys make snares for catching hares. They get some snare wire and twist it around then they put it on a stick and set it. They also make traps for birds when there is snow on the ground. In Summer all flowers are in bloom. When the cow slips are in full bloom we gather a great many of them and we make tilly tosses out of them. We get tread and get two to hold it, then we break the stem and put the flower on the thrread. We keep on doing that until we have enough on. Then we tie the two ends of the thread and the tilly toss is made.

Girls string flowers together into a belt or girdle.NECKLACES: Necklaces are made from primroses the stems are cut off and the heads of them are put on a piece of string. This makes a nice necklace.FOOL'S FACE: A piece of strong paper is got and coloured. Two holes are then cut out of it for the two eyes. Then the mouth and the nose are cut out of it. Then the fool's face is made.SKITTLES: Three pieces of wood about nine inches long are cut from a shovel or fork handle. Then five pieces about Three inches long are got and the tops of them are paired.SKIPPING ROPE: A skipping rope is made from four pieces of cord. I get two alder stick about two feet each.I bore a hole in each end of each sticks.These two sticks are joined together by two pointed ones.The two pointed ones are driven into the holes. Then i get some limber sticks and set them on the frame.TOP: This is for spinning. This is made from the brang of an apple tree. I get a short bit of the brang and pare it. 4933196/4756373/4933687.title: Homemade Toys
4933196/4756373/4933687.text: There is a big different between the way boys and girls amuse themselves now towards long ago.The boys used make tops, lanterns, and guns and the girls dolls. The way they made dancing dolls was to get alot of rags and put something around them to keep them together. then make the head. Made the legs very loosely so that they can dance. Then get a saw and hold the doll over it. Tip the saw and the doll would dance.The way they made guns was to get a spool and tied a piece of rubber on one end.

4933196/4756374/4933689.title: Homemade Toys
4933196/4756374/4933689.text: There were toys made in everyone house in the parish of Tullaroan long ago. Mrs. John Grace of Liss, Tullaroan, was able to make a dolls-houseThe way she made it was to get an orange box and cut it out in the shape of a house. When she had that done she got a piece of cloth and divided the house into an many parts that she liked. Then she put paper on house, and then she had it made.The people of the parish were able to make toy guns. They got an elder stick about one and a half feet long and scraped out the inside of it. Then they got a stick about the same length and made it fit into the hole and then the gun was made

4758581/4756416/4933873.title: Homemade Toys
4758581/4756416/4933873.text:
Most children make a toy of their own.You could make a doll by getting two potatoes a big one and a small one. Join the big potato on to the little one with a match. Then get four sticks, two for the hand and two for the feet. Stick two sticks under the big potato, and one in each side of the big potato. Then you can dress the doll with clothes



When boys and girls are small they delight in making toys.Girls make a doll from a potato. They cut it and put half of it in a stocking, and tie at the bottom. That forms the head. They colour it with chalk to make the eyes, mouth and nose. The other half makes the body. They tie sticks at both sides for hands. They tie sticks for the feet. Boys make a care from a card board box and lids of polish boxes.

4922018/4918897/4934150.text:

Headache. Vinegar is put on a cloth and tied tightly round the head. A cup of very strong tea is another cure.Earache: was cured by putting the juice from a roased onion into the ear. Heated Olive Oil is said to be the best cure and is most common in this district.Cuts. were cured by putting cobwebs over the cuts.Sore Necks. were cured by mixing fresh lard and boiled nettles and applying the plaster to the sore, another cure for sores is to make a plaster from burned potatoes and fresh lard.Whitlows. are cured by putting the affected finger into half a lemon, also by applying a poultice of bread and water and by bathing frequently in very hot water.Note : - (These cures were taken from the Folklore papers of the pupils of Askeaton Girls' N.S.).



These were made from reed, or wheaten straw. The straw was cut just above the knot,  and three or four inches were left at the other side of the knot. A small "tongue" was cut near the knot and a small piece of straw was inserted. The whistler was then ready

4922018/4918898/4934152.title: Homemade Toys
4922018/4918898/4934152.text:
(continued from previous page)
Pop-Guns. were made out of elder sticks. The soft pithy centres were scooped out so that the sticks were hollow in the centre. Then a thin stick with a knob on one end was got. This was something shorter than the elder stick and was called a "ram-rod". "Bullets" were made from chewed paper. One end of the gun was plugged with chewed paper, it was then pushed to the other and with the "ram-rod", then another bullet was inserted, with the force of air and the second bullet the first one was shot right through making noise like a gun.Boat-MakingBoats we made out of flat pieces of timber. These were pointed at one end, a small hole was bored in the centre for the "mast". Strings were tied from mast top to the ends of the boat and small pieces of cloth were tied on to represent sails.



Daisy Chains.Girls made daisy chains to amuse themselves. They first gathered the daisies. Then they made a hole in the stem and passed one in through the other until a good long string was formed.

4921945/4912267/4934288.title: Homemade Toys
4921945/4912267/4934288.text: Toys are made in the homes still such as yoyos and a catapult. A catapult is made when a (gallog) is got and two pieces of rubber and a piece of leather and a piece of cord. the rubber is tied on to the prong of the (gallog) and then the leather and rubber are tied together. A yoyo is made by getting two sides of reels and a piece of stick. the stick is put through the holes in the reels and a piece of cord is tied on to it, and then it is pulled up and down.

4921945/4912277/4934317.title: Homemade Toys
4921945/4912277/4934317.text: Many boys and girls make toys at home for amusements, such as kites, bow and arrows, guns, cars, and many other things. The favourite of those toys is the kite because on a windy day a person would attach a long cord to the kite and when the kite is blowing it is great amusement. Many boys use a catapult for shooting birds. The way for making a is as follows. A person would get a fork of wood from a tree. Then he would get two strips of rubber about six inches long by two and attach them to the fork. Then he would get a piece of leather and tie it to the rubber in the form of a sling.

The way to make a ball is to get thirty corks and mash them up, get a thin bit of leather and put the corks in a bit of leather and sow it up tightly with a bit of waxend.



The way to make a flute is with an elder stick make a hole through the stick then make a hole on the side then put a bit of paper on the end. The girls make chains out of dasies. 4742029/4729553/4935436.text:

Blue, put on the sting of a wasp, was considered a good cure.If you had warts and found water in the hollow of a rock, all you need do was to wash them in this water and they disappeared after a few days. If a person had whooping-cough he should go in and out under an asse's legs a number of times and it was cured. A sty on your eye was cured by making the sign of the cross on it with a gold wedding ring.

4742031/4729692/4936475.title: Homemade Toys
4742031/4729692/4936475.text: There are some people able to make toys. There is a man in Freshford called Mr Delaney who is able to make wooden lorries with wooden wheels. He also makes steam rollers and scooters and horses. He makes them all out of timber. He sells the lorries for nine pence each, the steam rollers for one shilling and six pence, the scooters two shillings and six pence and the horses for two shillings.

Long ago there were no factories to make toys the people made their own toys, some of those were, tops, snares and guns for the boys and daisy-chains and toss-bobs for the girls. Tops: Tops were made with a piece of thick stick and a nail put into the ends. Snares: They were made with wire and a stick, and then they tried to kill rabbits with them. Guns: These were made from pieces of wood.

The toys I saw made were rabbit-snares, pop-guns, tops, whistles and catapults.Rabbit-snare:  The way that snares are made is by getting snare-wire and platting seven or eight strands together.  Then get an eyelit
(continues on next page)

4922019/4919092/4936666.title: Homemade Toys
4922019/4919092/4936666.text: Long ago the boys made their own tops. They made them of ash. They used to put a steel spear in it. Long ago the boys made a crib for catching birds. They got elders and built them up like a house with a cord. Then they got a thin stick that they could bend, then they would put it into the crib. Then they got a short stick with prongs. They held up the crib and put the stick under it. When the bird came, it could pitch in the bow and it would snap and the bird was caught inside. They also made a hole through a stick and put in a haw. It was called a "haw shooter". Then they would blow it and it would fly into air. Girls made their own necklaces long ago out of flowers. They get primroses and netted them together with cords. They also made them out of daisies. They called it a daisy chain. They made their own dolls out of paper. They coloured it with paint. They made flowers also out of paper every colour some red and other colours.

4798736/4794586/4936705.title: Homemade Toys
4798736/4794586/4936705.text:
Home-Made Toys.During their spare time children make their own toys and find great amusement in playing with them. The boys can make their own hurley balls, tops for spinning, guns out of elder branches, cradle- birds for trapping birds, snares for catching rabbits, nets for catching fish and bows and arrows out of sally rods.In this locality the boys are very fond of hurling. They make their own balls and hurls quite simply.When making a hurley ball it is necessary to have some corks, wax end, an awl, thread and pieces of leather and a sharp knife. The corks are cut into small pieces about the size of a thimble, They are put together and tied with thread or twine into a round shape.Three pieces of leather are sewn together into a round shape, around the corks. They (pieces of leather) are joined by sewing with an awl and wax end.The hurley ball is then ready for play and hard knocks.
(continues on next page)

4922020/4919222/4937047.title: Hurling and Football
4922020/4919222/4937047.text:
(continued from previous page)
Dan and Thomas McNamara, residing still at Court Brown.Long ago handball and weight throwing were popular games in the district. At the cross dividing Ballycanana and Mitchelstown there was a ball alley. Games were played on Sundays and week evenings in the Summer by the neighbours.P'ina HollandGurthnagranaherFrom John Holland, Gurtnagranaher, aged 60.



In this district every boy and girl make toys to amuse themselves in their spare time. The boys make snares, guns, tops and they do some carpentry.To make snares four strands of snare-wire are twisted together leaving loops at the ends. One end is put through a loop making a bigger loop. A piece of cord is attached to the end and a stick is tied to this. The latter is stuck in the rabbits' 'run'.A piece of elder is obtained about afoot long and the pith is pushed out with a red poker. One end of the passage is stuffed with wadding or wet paper. Then an ashen stick is procured fitting the passage. This is pushed down the latter,
(continues on next page)

4922020/4919223/4937050.title: Homemade Toys
4922020/4919223/4937050.text:
(continued from previous page)
blowing out the wadding which makes a loud report. This is called a gun.One end of a thread-spool is pointed and a head is taken off a nail. The nail is driven down towards the point of the spool to make the spear of the top.The girls make daisy-chains and dolls' dresses and belts from sweet papers.A hole is made in the stem of a daisy and the stem of another is put through to start the chain. This continues until it is long enough. A sweet paper is folded from left to right making a crease. Then it is opened and the left and right sides are folded in to the crease, then it is closed in. After this it is folded in to make another crease and then the two sides are folded in to this. Many papers are folded thus and inserted one in the other allowing the ends to protrude. When the belt is finished it looks like a series of letter 'V' s.Nina HollandGurthnagranaher

4742046/4730771/4938790.text:
152      Homemade Toys.Boys and girls used to spend a lot of their time in making toys.The chief toys which the boys made were the catapult,the bow and arrow,the kite and little ships and boats made out of plywood.Girls made dolls and strung daisies and buttercups.When my mother was a small girl she made rag-dolls.She made tops from thread spools and necklaces from daisies.She used to make rabbits from handkerchiefs by nutting?the hankerchief together.

4742046/4730772/4938793.text: 153    Homemade Toys.I made a daisy chain many a time.My father made guns from elder branches and pipes.My brother made tops from thread spools,cut a little round block and stick a small stick in the hole.That is the way the top is made.These amusements are carried on yet.

4742046/4730773/4938794.title: Homemade Toys
4742046/4730773/4938794.text: 154         Homemade ToysIn this district,many girls string daisies and make necklaces out of red berries.The boys make catapults out of a forked stick,a small piece of rubber and two long pieces.The small piece and the long pieces are tied together and then tied to the stick.They make cages out of rushes for catching butterflies.Some boys make wooden swords.Doll's cradles are made from pieces of wood and then covered with cloth.I made one myself and covered it.In years gone by,my mother saw cats,dogs,dolls that were made at home,covered with velvet and stuffed with rags.

4742046/4730774/4938795.title: Homemade Toys
4742046/4730774/4938795.text: 155     Homemade Toys.A catapult is a homemade toy and made often in our district.Also a wooden sword,the catapult is made with a forked stick and a long piece of rubber tied to the stick with a piece of cord.The sword is made out of a thin piece of wood.A rabbit snare can be made easily out of wire,or a stick with cord tied to it.Girls make necklaces out of daisies and of berries.A rabbit can be made out of a piece of cloth stuffed with wool.A doll can be made the same way.

4742046/4730775/4938802.title: Homemade Toys
4742046/4730775/4938802.text:
156     Homemade Toys A homemade toy which is entirely gone out of fashion was the bow and arrow,which was made from a piece of wood about four feet long and two inches thick.A hollow was carved down the centre,on which the arrow rested,A small hole was made in one end,through which a tough rod or the spring of an old umbrella was drawn.A string cord was then used.Each end of the cord was fastened on to the ends of the rod or spring.The string was then drawn back firmly to almost the other end of the wood and caught on a little track cut right across the wood.This could be easily shifted off with the thumb when taking aim with the arrow.A sharp speck of wood or iron was then placed in the hollow on top of the wood.The cord was shifted off with the thumb,as the spring flew back with such speed to their proper place,the cord struck the arrow and drove it at great speed sometimes carrying it twenty or
(continues on next page)

First of all children gather a bunch of daisies and then they cut the stem to about one and a half inches long. The end of the stem of one daisy is holed and the stem of another is pushed through it. This is continued until the chain is the required length. Then the head of the first is threaded through the stem of the last to join the chain.Boys find great amusement in snaring rabbits. Whistles are made from corn, ash-sticks and reeds.Wind-mills can be made from bits of wood, turkey feathers and bits of tin.Pop guns are made from an old spring of a clock and a branch of an elder berry bush.Catapults are usually made from a piece of rubber and a "fork" stick.A sling is made from a piece of leather and two cordsTo make a bow and arrow one straight sick, one curved stick and a piece of twine is necessaryHorns are made out of empty spools with a piece of rubber across one endTo make a buzzer a tin lid with the edges flattened and a piece of cord are required, put two holes near each other, neat the centre of the lid. 4723810/4715528/4939443.text:
Stringing Flowers.This game is played by girls in the summer when the flowers are plentiful. A bunch of flowers are gathered and a hole is made in the end of the stem of each. Two flowers are taken from the bunch and the stem of one is passed through the hole in the end of the other one. Then the another daisy is passed through the hole of the last one. The game continued in this way until a long string is made.The RattlerThis game is played mostly by girls. The rattler is made from five rushes woven through each other until only a little piece of the rushes remains. A few small stones are then put into it and the ends of the rushes are tied. When this is shaken it makes a very loud noise.The SpinnerUsually this game is played by boys in the Winter. The sides

4742073/4732829/4940612.text:
Snare for catching hares or rabbits are made from copper wire about one twelfth of an inch in diameter. To make a snare four wires are required. These are about one foot six inches in length. First the wires are placed side by side, thus [illustration]. The ends A are knotted to the handle of the cover of an oven. The ends B are held in one hand, Then the cover which is suspended from the wires is turned round and round with the other hand in order to twist the wires. When they are twisted the knot attached to the cover of the oven is undone. Then a loop about half an inch long is make at each end, thus, [illustration]. One loop is then pulled through the other so as to form a noose, thus, [illustration].Next a piece of cord is attached to the loop A as well as to a piece of stick about a foot long. 4742073/4732842/4940619.text:
Tops ("dancers") were made from thread spools as follows. First, the hole in the spool was plugged with a piece of timber. Then, by means of a breakfast or dinner knife, the spool was reduced to the shape of a cone, thus [illustration]. Next a nail with a blunt point was inserted at the tapering end of the spool, thus [illustration]. About a quarter inch of this nail was exposed so as to form the axis on which the top would spin.

4940775/4731664/4940818.title: Local Toys
4940775/4731664/4940818.text:
The following toys were made at home. - "Plug Guns." A piece of elder-tree was got the inside of which is soft.  This was cut about 1 1/2 feet long and 2 ins broad.  The inside was pushed out of this.  A piece of straight rod of any kind was used to drive out the plugs.  These plugs were usually pieces of chewed paper.  These plugs were driven out with great force and they usually made a shot.Scouts.  A plant which grows in the ditches called a scout and is hollow in the centre but at every joint there is a covering.  This was cut about 2 feet long off by the joint.  Holes were bored in the joint usually with a pin or a knitting needle.  A straight piece of a rod was then got and a piece of a rag and twisted it round one end of it.  This was then stuck into the scout and the scout dipped in water.  The rod was then pulled up and it drew up the water.  When the rod was pushed down again the water went out in a spray.Daisy Chains.  Girls usually made these.  First
(continues on next page)

4723869/4720857/4941272.text:
A person could make a toy man from blue-clay. This clay was got five feet from the top of the Earth. When it is formed the model was left out in the sun until it was dry and hard. When hard it was whitened with white wash.A person could get a piece of loutry stick about two inches in circumference and cut a long hole in it with a penknife and put a piece of spring wire in it. This made a gun with which they could shoot matches.
(continues on next page)



To make a bow and arrow get a stick five yards long and bend it. Get half a yard of eleastic. Tie each end of the elastic to each end of the bent stick. Get a straight stick for an arrow.With a piece of a bicycle tube or a piece of soft leather make a sling. Cut two holes, one in each

4723869/4720860/4941274.text: The way a butter flie's cage is made. First Get rushes and put one between each of my four fingers, then turn the three rushes down over the one, then put one across, and turn the two ends of the other rush, then another and do the same again until you cannot hld any more and then cut off the longer rushes and tie a string round the rushes, so that the rushes will not fall from other.The way a Daisy Chain is made. First of all I would get a number of daisies and put one little hole at the end of oen and put one through it, and do the same with the others.

Get a sedge one stem of it, make a hole with a penknife about a half inch from top of it. Then get a small bit of  timber and put it up through hollow of sedge until it meets hole you made. The whistler is then made.

4922008/4917876/4941484.title: Homemade Toys - Another Homemade Whistler
4922008/4917876/4941484.text: Get an elder stick about three inches or longer. Scrape out all the stuff inside and make a hole about 1/4 inch on the shell, block in the end of stick and the air will whistle as it goes out this hole.

4922008/4917877/4941485.title: Homemade Toys - A Homemade Doll
4922008/4917877/4941485.text: This is the way we make home-made dolls.A doll is made by getting a cloth and putting in the middle some hay and get four thin sticks and stick them in the hay two for the legs and the other two for the hands. You must get a cord and squeeze it very thightly round the hay and sticks to secure the head.The doll is made then.

4922008/4917878/4941486.title: Homemade Toys - Homemade Spinning Tops
4922008/4917878/4941486.text: Get a block of wood about 3 cubic inches, get a chisel and pare down the sides of it in a slanting direction until a point is almost made round the top and cut lines round the top and finally 6" nail, cut off head and 3" of stem off drive the blunt side in the top. Leave about 1/2 inch projecting for spear.

4922008/4917879/4941487.title: Homemade Toys - A Flog-Gun
4922008/4917879/4941487.text: Get a stick of elder about 6 inch long and scrape out all the stuff in side in it and then make a ram-rod to fit the stick leaving a end in it not to leave it go down through the stick. Then you would get pellets made from toe of flax. The flog gun is made.

4922008/4917880/4941488.title: Homemade Toys - A Homemade Pipe
4922008/4917880/4941488.text: Get a potatoe and scoop a hole in it, in the shape of a pipe. Then get a quil and cut the top and bottom off it and stick into the side of the pipe to make a stem.

4922008/4917881/4941492.title: Homemade Toys - A Homemade Crib
4922008/4917881/4941492.text: When I made a crib I got hazel rods about one foot long. I took four and make a square frame. Then I put a double cord from each corner and built up the sticks inside by laying them over each other and fastened by the cord when they are piled so as to make a type of cover dish. A stick is twisted in between the four cords and tightened. A bow and gablog are got. The bow is put in at two corners so as to make a letter D. The gablog is longside the crib and a piece of a cipin is placed to keep the crib up.

4922197/4860022/4941671.title: Local Cures
4922197/4860022/4941671.text:

A cure they had for rheumatism was to boil paraffin-oil and water and rub it to the limbs.An old custom was to hang up a small piece of bacon on a salley rod on the inside of the house on Shrove Tuesday and to eat it on Easter Sunday morning. It is said that who ever would eat it they would not get a disease for that year.Another old custom is that he would eat three meals of nettles in the month of March would not get any sickness for the year.

The toys I make for pastime are a doll, the way I make it is to get a small piece of coloured paper and fold it and then make the hands on it and make the face with a piece of white paper and traw out the face on it with a pencil.Old people can give an account of what they made when younf. An article they made was a pop gun. The way they made it was to get a thick clear bush and take out the pith of it and a ram rod to shoot out the shot.

In olden times people were not very good at making toys as there was no machinery, and all the toys were made by hand. The way they made the dolls was out of old pieces of rags. They would sew them together and stuff them with shavings of wood. They would mark out the shape of the eyes and nose and mouth with a quill pen. The quill pens were made out of turkeys feather. 4742061/4731827/4942104.title: Homemade Toys
4742061/4731827/4942104.text: The people long ago got britevy long and bored a hold through the middle of it and got a think stick and made two plugs of flax and put one plug in one end and filled the hole up with air and put the other plug in the other end and put in the thin stick and pushed out the plugs and it let a crack. There were jackstones played with five small round stones.

4723846/4718271/4943003.title: Homemade Toys
4723846/4718271/4943003.text: The way to make a plug gun is to get a good straight piece of elder and burn a hole in it. Then get a straight piece of stick and pare it till you get it to fit into the hole. But do not pare it to the very top of the stick or it will run through the hole altogether. Leave it thicker at one end to form a handle.The way to make a spindle is to get the wheel of an old clock.The way to make a buzzer is get the lid of a cocoa box and cut the sides off it. Then get a nail, put two holes in the middle of it and nick the edge of it with an old pair of scissors.Put a cord through the holes.The way to make a catapult is to get a forked stick and a long stripe of rubber get a piece of cord and thread it through the ends of the rubber and tie it to the top of the stick and pull the rubber as far back as you can pull it and the rubber as far back as you can pull it and with the force of the rubber, coming back sends the stone away.

4723846/4718272/4943010.title: Homemade Toys
4723846/4718272/4943010.text: You make skittles in this way. First you get a long bit of a stick. Then you take the saw and saw them into five different lengths seven, eight and nine inches long. That is the way you make skittles.The way to make plug guns is to get a piece of beutry. Then you will redden an iron in the fire and when it is red take it out and bore a hole in the beutry. When you have it bored you will get a piece of stick and pare it until you have it round. Then fit it in the hole to see if it will fit. When you have it made you will get a piece of tow or flax and chew it until you have it wet. Then take the ramrod and put it in tightly and then shoot with it. That is the way you make a plug-gun. To make balls roll up horse hair and roll it until you have it tight and hard. Then get a piece of cloth and sew it up. Then you will put the horse hair and wool and old rags inside the cloth and tighten it up hard. When you have it hard sew it up and that is the way you make a ball.

4723846/4718273/4943011.title: Homemade Toys
4723846/4718273/4943011.text:
293Home made ToysTo play skittles the first thing you do is to make a ring on the road. Then you get five pieces of wood not of equal size. The number twenty is the largest. The next two which are numbered are not so large as the number twenty. There are two more pieces of wood which are numbered five. They are the smallest two. Then you get three pieces of sticks about a couple of feet in length and fire them. The person who can clear the ring wins fifty. Each person gets his own turn. The game goes on until the first person scores one hundred. Then he has won the game.The way to make a plug-gun is to cut a hard branch from the [?] bush or elder tree and cut a piece off it about a foot long. Then you get the poker and warm it in the fire. Then you put the poker or a bar of iron down through the [?] to clean it out. Then you get a piece of tow or flax and chew it until it is round to go down through the gun. Then you get a piece of wood and pare it until it is round and thin enough to push the plugs out. The gun is now ready for using. You
(continues on next page)

4723846/4718275/4943012.title: Homemade Toys
4723846/4718275/4943012.text:
295Home made ToysWe gather a large number of daisies. Then we take one to begin with and make a hole at the end of the stem and put another stem through the hole and pull the second stem until the head is at the hole in the first daisy. Then make another hole through the second daisy stem and put another daisy stem through it. Go on in the same way till the daisies are all in a long chain. Then join it by putting the first daisy head through the the last daisy stem.To make a doll, we proceed in this way. We get a piece of cloth and fold it and cut it out the shape of a doll and sew it up the sides. Then stuff it with old wool, sawdust or tow. Then we paint its face with white paint and put red paint on its cheeks. Then we put clothes on it and it is just nearly as good and more lasting than a doll that was bought.To make reins we start as follows.

297Home Made ToysI am going to explain how to make a daisy chain, rag-doll, reins, bubbles and basket weaving.To make a daisy chain you go out into a field where there are plenty of daisies. Pluck one daisy and make a hole in it with a darning needle, take another daisy and put it through the hole. Then you take other daisies and do the same until you have the required length.To make a rag doll you get a piece of cloth large enough for the body and stuff it with rags and sew it up. You also make a head, arms and legs in the same manner and sew them to the body. Then you paint two eyes, a nose and a mouth on the head piece. You can make frocks for it then.If you want reins you could crochet a pair. Get a crochet needle and a piece of wool and begin to crochet a long string.If you do not know how to make bubbles, get a basin of water and a piece of soap and rub the soap on your hands and make your hands all suddy. Then touch your thumb and first finger together until a skin of soap appears between the two. Then blow

Many boys in this locality made areoplanes. The wood is prepared by cutting it into pieces and shaped. Each piece fits in its own place to form the body. 4922025/4919590/4943891.title: Homemade Toys
4922025/4919590/4943891.text: Toys most favoured by boys of the 19th century included, the pop Gun which was made of Elder wood about 1 ft long the pitch being burned from the centre to make a barrel. Piecies of cork were used as pellets.Another home made toy being a ball made of thread and stiched with twine used Cricket or hurling, sometimes a ball of this kind would be covered with leather by local bootmakers it would then be called a slither.Another toy made of elder and used for catching birds was called a crib. A bow of osier used as a spring so as to fall with the weight of a bird. Toy (were boat sometimes) boats were sometimes made imitation yachts and sailed on loughs of water. Another toy made localy at that time was Peg top, the wooden part being made by a carpenter on a Lathe the spe being made by Blacksmith. Toys favoured by girls were rag dolls. Rush chairs made on the finger and toss balls made of cowslips neck-laces made of Daisies.

4922090/4851502/4944812.title: Homemade Toys
4922090/4851502/4944812.text:
Home Made Toys				Fifty years ago in my father's time he made cribs for catching birds. In the frost and snow the crib was set to catch birds. They were raised slightly at one side from the ground with the aid of a stick which fell away at the slightest touch of the bird who ventured to get the food placed by the boys. 	The crib was made with sally twigs between strings and shaped like a basket. 	Snares for catching hares and rabbits were made with copper wire from which the loop was made where the hares would run through. A string was firmly attached to some object in the ground and set in the hares or rabbits were supposed to run. 	Fancy lanterns were made from turnips by scooping out the center only leaving a thick skin in which little windows or fancy holes were left for the light of the candle which was fixed in the center.
(continues on next page)

Then I put a piece of raw potato in the elder, and I shoved the ash stick down. The pressure of air drove the piece of potato out very quickly.



I often made a crib. I got two elder sticks and I made a hole in the end of each stick. Then I got two ash sticks and I put them through the holes in the elder sticks. Then I got two pieces of twine. I got a gouloge to hold the twine. Then I got ash sticks and I wound the twine around them. This is how I set the crib. I got a briar and I wound it around the elders that were on the bottom. Young boys find great pleasure in making kites as they like to see it going very high on a windy day, and young girls find great pleasure in making dolls. Boys also make tops and floguns from elder branches, from which they find great sport. Cribs for catching birds are another great favourite for young boys as they love to be catching birds in snowy and frosty weather. Snares for catching hares and rabbits is also made at home, carried on by young and old as some of the old make a living by

Next tie a piece of cord to each corner of the crib, each about 9" long, knot them at the top, next get straight elder sticks and put one on top of the other. Every boy makes something when they have spare time. Boys find great pleasure making snares for catching rabbits which is a very interesting pastime for young and old. First of all you must get six bits of snare where each of which must be a foot or 2 foot and a half in length and put them in a strong piece of a stick. You must leave a loop in it in order it would slip up and down. If you want to catch a rabbit you must put it between the patches of

4922097/4852178/4947007.title: Toys
4922097/4852178/4947007.text:
1. Daisy-chain. Get a daisy with a long stem. Then get the heads of a lot of other daisies and hole them with the stem of the long daisy. Put all the heads on the stem until you have a chain made  of them. 2. Ringlets. Get the head of the dandelion put your finger on the top of the stem bruise it down, and it will go in ringlets. 3. Horse-chestnut necklace. Get a cord and as many horse-chestnuts as you can find. Hole all the chestnuts with a nail, and run the cord through them all, and this is the way you make it. 4. Boats. Get a piece of board and make three holes in it. put three feathers into the holes and then put it into a river, and the boat will go whatever way the wind is blowing. 5. Sling. Get the tongue of a boot and make a hole in each end of it. Put two strings into the holes. Put a stone into the tongue and winde the sling around your head let go of one of the strings and the stone will fly off. 6. Haw gun. There is a kind of a plant growing and you get it mostly in Summer
(continues on next page)

4922098/4852211/4947097.title: Homemade Toys
4922098/4852211/4947097.text:
Long ago boys played with marbles which they made themselves by mixing mud and water, shaping the mixture into the marbles and letting them harden.Girls played with "gob" stones which were small smooth stones.Nowadays girls often make dolls of rags or thread and play with them.They make "daisy chains". Also "toss balls" made of cowslips.Boys also made "teetotum" of timber.



"Travelling" still call to the houses. Some of these have been doing so for many years. Sometimes in times gone by when they were younger, they worked for the farmers in many ways. The women sometimes did a day's washing, or weeded the gardens, or helped building the sheaves of corn. The men also helped and got fed and paid.One traveller named Nelly Boody often came from the west of Limerick

4921951/4912780/4947260.title: Homemade Toys
4921951/4912780/4947260.text:
Girls make chains of daisies. First a long rush is stuck in through the centre of each daisy. These were called daisy chains. Boys made tops from thread spools by getting a spool and painting it and then they stuck a nail or a piece of painted stick down through the centre of the spool as a spear. Cradle birds were made from catching birds by making a frame of strong sticks. The corners were joined with cords light twigs were woven through these and tied on the top. The crib was raised on the side and a stick called a gowlogue was caught under it with a bow trap and a string was tied on to this stick, and when the bird gets into the crib the strong was pulled and the crib will fall down on the bird and he is caught.



Snares for trapping rabbits were made from light wires platted together. An eye is left at one end of it and the other is run through that eye. Then a peg is driven into the ground and the wire is tied to it. Another short stick is placed underneath the wire in such a way the wire will be a little up off

head is to keep a hankerchief around it.  A cure for a sore, is to rub ointment to it.  There is a cure in paying a round at Lady's Well.



A crib for catching birds is a home made toy.  There are a lot of nice things made at the woodwork class at Mr. Vaughan's workhouse.  Thee were presses, chairs, gates, and a hall stand, made there.  Girls makes necklaces out of flowers.



Some people do not like to start a thing on Monday.  They do not think it lucky.  One May eve, people shake holy water around their place.  People like to have early potatoes set for the seventeenth of March.  If a person dies, and is to be buried on Monday, the grave is reddened on Sundays.  Some people think it not lucky to take horses out of a field on Monday if they were in it for a long time.

4922080/4850435/4949201.title: Homemade Toys
4922080/4850435/4949201.text:
Boys and girls find amusements for themselves in their spare time. Girls string flowers together. Boys make tops from thread-spools and from pieces of timber, guns from elder-branches, "cribs" in which to trap birds in snowy weather and snares for catching hares or rabbits.The way to make a crib is:-Get four flat sticks, cross them and tie them together at each corner. Then get four smaller sticks and do the same thing. This is done until the cage goes up in a point. Then put in a bit of stick under the crib and crumbs of bread and when the bird goes into the crib, it will down and the bird will not be able to get out.How to make a sling.Get a piece of leather and hole the two ends of it. Put cord into the two holes. Knots are put under the two holes. The loose ends of the cord are held in the hand. Put a stone into the leather. Swing the sling round and round to gain force. When letting the stone off, release one end of the cord.
(continues on next page)

How to make a car.Get a small box from a shop and four tailor's reels or lids of polish boxes for the wheels. Tie a piece of cord for the traces. The children fill those with sand and all sorts of things and pull the load after them.



Some boys and girls make toys of their own. The girls make toys of some flowers. They make chains of daisies and buttercups. They make balls of cowslips. They make crows' legs of long grasses and wreaths of flowers.The boys make bird-traps, haw-shooters, slings and thread-balls for hurling. A game called "Soldiers" is played with a long grass which has a black head. A game called "Conquers" is played with the nut of the Horsechestnut tree.The way to make a daisy chain is : - make a hole in the stem of a daisy and put another daisy stem in through the hole. Then put another hole in the stem of that daisy and so on. A cowslip ball is made by breaking off all the stems and hanging the heads of them on a piece of twine or thread. When there are lots of cowslips on the thread pull the thread tight and

4922000/4916861/4949294.text:
Home Made Toys 15-6-38There are many attractive and amusing toys which boys and girls with an aptitude may make at home without expense. Boys make pop guns out of the stem of a weed which bears white blossoms and grows on river banks and marshy places. The stem is about the circumference of a bicycle pump and is generally cut to about the same length as such. There is a small hole made in the top of the stem and when a rod of less circumference is inserted in the hollow stem and operated the same as a bicycle pump, a report like that of an air gun occurs. Out of pieces of card board “dancers” are made. First the head and body of a pencilled out on one piece of such and then cut accordingly. The two legs are then cut separately and pinned on to the first piece in such a way that the legs are loose. A piece of thread is then attached to the head and held in the hand slightly tipping the thread with the finger the legs move as if dancing.Girls can make dolls by
